Mrs Sâm is 53 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Sâm lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable.

In 2013, Sâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Sâm has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Sâm is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her solidarity group.

The main hardship that Sâm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. With her business profit, Sâm hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for each of her children to find a good job.

Mrs. Trâm is 27 years old and she is married with two children. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for six years. Trâm lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village, moreover this job is unstable. She must work hard to keep sending two children to school.

In 2014, Trâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Trâm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Trâm is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her solidarity group.

The main hardship that Trâm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish. With her business profit, Trâm hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

Mrs Phương is 51 years old and married with six children. She has operated a food stall/restaurant, selling fish for more than 10 years.
Phương lives in Quang Xuong district; a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village. Moreover, this job is unstable. 

In 2014, Phương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Phương is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her solidarity group. The main hardship that Phương faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to build a new house.

Hòa, 59, is married with three children and is known as a reputable person in her community. Her family is considered a low-income household in their village near Ha Trung, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

For the past twelve years Hòa has sold groceries such as sweets, sugar, cake and milk. The market need is low in this area, though, and she faces a lack of capital to build up her business.

Although this will be Hòa’s first loan with Thanh Hoa, her group members voted for her to be the leader of their solidarity group. She has now applied on their behalf for a 35,000,000 VND loan through Kiva's field partner Thanh Hoa to be apportioned among the group. With her share she will buy additional groceries to sell.

With her profits Hòa hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. Her goal is to make it a success.

Mrs. Hà is 32 years old and she is married.

She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for two years. Hà lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hà faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

In 2013, Hà joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

Mrs Xuân is 51 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit for five years.

Xuân lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, and the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Xuân faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

In 2013, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Xuân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

Some people believe that a married mother of four can do nothing except taking care of her family members. Well many women prove that this is totally wrong and they can achieve almost more than what a man can do.

Nadia is a remarkable example of a hardworking mother of four who managed to raise her children, take care of her family, and start her own Mouneh business at home. She then decided in February 2015 to open a clothes and accessories selling shop which is located in a good region.

Nadia is 42 years now, and she is full of future expansion plans that she is working hard to achieve. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua, to increase and diversify her business merchandise with a special winter season collection to increase her selling.

She hopes to continue expanding and diversifying her business in a well managed way to make sure that she can always be a main supporter in her family, and cover her children education fees.

Hiba is a 25-year-old married mother of one child.  She started around two years ago, selling clothes and perfumes from her house to support her beloved husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.
Hiba is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is gaining a good reputation among her region. Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special offers and items for this winter season to attract customers attention and increase her income.
She will keep on expanding her business until she become able to open her own shop which will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

Ghada is a 38-year-old mother of four. Two years ago, she started selling detergents from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is a hardworking and ambitious woman who is becoming well-known in her region. 

Ghada is working hard to develop her business. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new detergents. These new offerings will help Ghada to satisfy her customers' demands. 

Ghada hopes to expand her business more in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

This is Manal, a 37-year-old married mother of four and hardworking wife of a hardworking farmer. Ten months ago, she established her current shoe shop to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living expenses.

Her newly established business is going on just fine, but she needs external financial support to develop it properly. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her newly established business' merchandise with a special offer winter collection to increase her sales volume.

At the beginning, Manal worked hard to find her current business location, and is working hard so that in the future, she can open another branch in the city to attract more customers and improve her family's standard of living. She is still educating her children, and is working hard to see them graduate from university in the future with remarkable degrees.

Samah, a 33-year-old, divorced woman has been working as a sales person in a clothes-selling shop for two years.

She is doing her best to develop her living and proving herself in her region.

Samah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to buy a car necessary for her transportation to her work since she lives in a remote area.

She believes that this car will be a successful means of transportation and will help her in establishing her own business in the future.

Amal is 48 and she is a married mother of four. In 1993, she started cooking from her house as her home-based work. She enjoys what she is doing since this is her hobby, which she has been working hard to develop through the years.

Her husband plays drums and she enjoys his work a lot. She is planning to add an extra income business to her family. That’s why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to start an additional income business, through buying a car and setting it for renting services. She is looking forward for this business and hopes to succeed, so that one day she can have her family renting car business.

Fatima is a 63-year-old married mother of two children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, she started twenty years ago working in an orchard with limited salary to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Fatima is trying to develop a business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a taxi which she will rent and benefit from it. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

Zeinab is 39-year-old married mother of five, who has been running her shoe and accessories shop since 2013.

She decided to start this business to assist her beloved husband with their family's income and to cover their increasing living expenses.

Zeinab sells shoes, bags, beauty products and accessories. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a newly released special winter collection to cover her customers' special requests, and to continue developing her business in a well managed way.

Zeinab hopes that she can work on developing her business more through diversifying her merchandise and moving to a wider shop in the future.

Lana, a 32-year-old married mother of three, has been running her convenience store for three years to support her husband who works selling vegetables. He displays them on an extension in a small market to earn his family's living.

Lana is trying her best to develop her shop, but her income combined with her husband's is barely enough to cover her family's increasing living needs. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase and diversify her business merchandise with special offer products highly requested by her customers.

She hopes that she can continue expanding and developing her business in a well-managed way to make sure she can support her husband and continue educating their children.

RANI is age 42, living with her husband and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband provides the services of changing the seat covers in vehicles. He purchases ready-made seat covers and stitches seat covers as well. His shop is situated in the vehicle workshop market. He has to pick up customers one by one and convince them to change the seat covers in their vehicle.

He does not take much of his customers' time and quickly changes the seat covers. Earlier he was providing services only for motorbike seats, but now he wants to provide services for various cars as well. For this purpose he wants to buy various colors and types of rexine (artificial leather) so that he can show his arts for sewing car seats.

Therefore, RANI requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy various types of rexine for sewing and selling vehicle seat covers. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Naseem is a lady with an understanding of the matters of her husband. She is residing in a small area of Multan, Pakistan.

She 42 years old and the mother of three children, managing her home along with her husband in peace. However, for some time now they are facing hard times, as her husband is not able to earn enough, due to his taxi's failure that needs to be repaired.

For that reason, Naseem applied for a loan from KIVA through it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan, her family's issues could be resolved and they could again live the life they used to live.

Brunilda has shown herself to be a determined, entrepreneurial and responsible woman. Thanks to the previous loan, she was able to achieve various parts of her goal proposals for personal improvement. Now, this is the second time she is requesting a loan to continue growing in her business of making refreshments such as freezer pops, gelatin snacks and flavored drinks.

Having the responsibility for three children, aged 17, 10 and 9, is the motor of her life. Brunilda now needs this loan to invest in the purchase of flavorings, acidifiers and plastic items in order to make high-quality products and offer the best to her customers.

Shoirakhon lives in a village with her husband. She was born in 1989 and has three children. The family gathers its main income from farming; they cultivate potatoes, beans and onions and grow fruit trees. In addition to farming, she also would like to get involved in cattle breeding.

She has applied for this loan to purchase three oxen. Such expansion will significantly increase her profit from agriculture, which she plans to use for purchasing more cattle in the future and to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni (TJS) with this aim. She needs money.

For two years, Jemuel has supported his family by running a sari-sari (variety) store business in the town of Ajuy, Iloilo, where he sells assorted fruits, seasonings and snack foods. He is a married man and has two children; ages seven and five years old.

Jemuel wants to improve his business in the future so he can better sustain and support the needs of their children. He is asking for a larger amount of loan money to buy goods such as fruits, peanuts, snack foods, food seasonings, cereals and drinks. In this way, he will be able to improve his business and make it more productive as well.

Luz, 50, studied to second grade. Her husband is a bricklayer and she has two children; only a daughter lives with her.

Luz sells clothing in the city center. She started the business five years ago and learned about it from a friend who is in the same line of work. Luz also receives economic support from one of her children. She only has done housework in the past as she is a humble homemaker who likes to attend to people.

Her work schedule for selling clothing is from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon.

Luz is in need of a loan to buy shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, underwear, etc. to stock her clothing business. This loan will be of great influence in her life as she will be able to earn a profit from the sales to support her household.

Her dream is to continue prospering in the business since it is difficult to get better employment due to her scarce education. She knows it is not easy but the need to get ahead motivates her to improve her situation.

Phala, 42, is a married mother with five children. She lives in Kandal Province in Cambodia. She is a factory worker, and has been in this job since 2007, earning around 7 USD per day. Two of her children are factory workers, while the other three children are attending school. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning around 5 USD per day.

Phala lives in an old house, so she wants to build a new house for her family. Because of a shortage of funds in her budget, she is now applying for a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI to buy construction materials for building a new house. Through this loan, she hopes that she can experience living in a comfortable house and have better living conditions.

As for her plans, she is going to support her children's earning bachelor’s degrees.

Doreen is kind-hearted, well organized, honest, industrious and entrepreneurial. She is a mother who makes sure her two children never go to bed hungry. She hails from the Ingaa, Chuka area of Kenya. Doreen never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job, but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life.

Doreen has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered much experience and learned important farming techniques. She practices dairy and mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education. Doreen believes that education is the key to success.

She is seeking a loan of KES 150,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm, and also to build a modern dairy unit. Doreen wants to take advantage of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, and reap more profits. Through the loan she will be able to build a modern dairy unit, which will help prevent her cow from harsh weather conditions, and also she will have a humble time milking the cows.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help hardworking women like Doreen to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. She hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Doreen’s dreams and projections are that by the end of the second quarter in 2016, she will not only be selling in the local market, but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning, because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

Doreen is not a self-centered woman who only thinks of herself. She will also want to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm and have an impact on society. Be part of this beautiful dream by helping Doreen with the loan she needs.

A loan will help Ruzanna to pay for forage for the livestock and to buy 5 piglets to enrich her farm. Ruzanna is a farmer from Sasnashen village, where she lives with her large family: husband and 5 children. She started farming activity with her own resources 15 years ago. She does the implementation of sales only in Talin town. Ruzanna says that the business would go better, if the prices of the agricultural products were not so low.

Ruzanna plans to pay for barley, grass, condensed feed for the livestock and to buy 5 farrow pigs to enrich the farm, where now she keeps 2 cows, 20 sheep, 30 hens, 2 farrows and 2 pigs, with the acquired loan.

Ruzanna will be very glad to receive your support in hope of improving her farming business.

Zouhour is a 28-year-old married mother of three. She is a Palestinian refugee who is working hard to support her husband in covering their family's living needs and expenses.

She has two children who are registered in a public school. She prefers private school, but it is too expensive and she and her husband can't afford it.

In 2011, Zouhour started her current home-based clothes selling business. She was advised by her neighbor to start it to support her husband in making their living.

Zouhour's business and house is located in a Palestinian refugee camp, and she is working hard to overcome the problem of limited customers in the camp by working outside the camp upon her customers' recommendations.

To do this she must increase her business capital and merchandise, and so she acquired a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. This will help Zouhour increase and diversify her business merchandise with a special winter collection.

Zouhour will work hard to expand and develop her business to make sure that she can provide her family a healthy and happy living.

Fatima is a 51-year-old woman who started a bakery in April 2015. It is a main income business for her family's living.

Today, Fatima has five years of experience and is well known in her region for her special Manakish and pastries that she prepares.

She is a caring married mother of five, who is very skilled in providing her family with the necessary living conditions, especially education.

Fatima requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a refrigerator to keep her products and raw materials fresh.

Fatima is looking forward to open a bakery in the city to attract more customers.

Kan is a 53-year-old married mother with five children and she resides in the Kandal Province in Cambodia. She earns some income from the business of selling fish, vegetables and chicken at a market since 2012. Her three children are factory workers and two attend school. Her husband is a 58-year-old and he also earns some income from fish selling. Together, they can earn around USD 28 each day.

Kan would like to improve her family’s finances, so she needs a loan to buy more fish, vegetables and chicken to sell at the market. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy these items and she will earn more income to support her family.

In the future, she is going to expand her business, save money to build a bigger house and support her children to go through high school.

Saret is a 27-year-old mother of two children who earns a living through farming cassava and works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for five years and the current business allows her to save about 4USD each day. Having not enough working capital to support on her farming is the main challenge for her business.

Saret is a fourth cycle client with VisionFund and she has repaid those previous loans completely. She is now leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the group leader, Saret wants to use her portion to pay for labor fee, which is expected to grow her root crop productivity. She hopes to gain more yield so as to increase her income.

Khafiza is a resident of the Gissar District. She is 59 years old. She is divorced from her husband and lives with her daughter and granddaughter. Her daughter works as a teacher in a secondary school. Khafiza is a hardworking and determined person. If she gives herself a goal, she will accomplish it.

Now her biggest goal is to open her own business and improve the financial situation of her family. She has long been interested in the retail sector, specifically buying and reselling women's clothing. She considers this to be a profitable business. Khafiza has already bought a stall at the local market. With the loan, she wants to bring in a collection of women's fabrics and scarves from the wholesale market in the capital and sell them in her stall at a profit. Khafize is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Marleny is 59 years old and is a happy married woman. She lives with her husband in the municipality of Ebejico, where she has 2 businesses because she’s a great entrepreneur. She has a store in her town and she also raises pigs so she has more means to provide for her family.

She wants to improve both of her businesses so she’s going to invest in both to improve the sales and increase the profits, but also to make them sustainable. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy supplies to stock up her store and also to buy 3 pigs to raise.

She dreams of improving her house, so with a little help she will accomplish that and more. Support her and loan now.

Beghum is a 43-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, along with her family. She is the mother of six children; one of whom goes to school. Her husband is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard at home and sells them at a local market or to butchers. He has to feed the calves for one or two years until they are grown up and healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure.

A few days ago, his one healthy cow has died due to fetal disease; he has been increasing the cattle through breeding from that cow but now his breeding procedure has been badly affected. He wants to buy a cow to keep the breeding procedure constant, but he has already invested all of his savings into his current cattle farm. He does not have a sufficient amount to buy a cow to continue breeding.

Therefore, Beghum has requested a Kiva loan so her husband can buy a healthy cow with the contribution of savings. She agreed with the repayment schedule and signed happily all the necessary documents, including the client waiver.The fetal diseases are the major challenges for him. With the profit, her husband will buy fodder for cattle and treatments against diseases. She is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

Sadia is a 37-year-old, married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a clothes selling business for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community and makes enough through this business to contribute to the family income. 

Sadia has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy more stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. This way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

Rosa, 28 years old, is partnered and has a child. Her partner works as a mechanic and, in addition, Rosa's mother lives with them, but only her young son depends on her.

Rosa is a woman with a lot of business initiative. She works selling watches, purses and clothing. She has had this business for 3 years and has acquired experience over time. Her mother has done the same work for many years, it was in this way that Rosa learned the work. Rosa travels by the city bus and works from 8 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. In this way, she gets income from her work and it helps her to support her son, her mother, and help her partner with the household expenses.

She needs this loan to purchase more watches for women and men, purses of all styles, and clothing. This will influence Rosa's life a lot, since she will be able to have the funds to stock her business and not see herself at a standstill in her earnings.

She dreams of establishing a more organized retail space and attracting more customers and, in this way, giving her son better living conditions and a better education. She will achieve this with her work and with the help of Credicampo and Kiva.

Santos is 46 years old. She is hard-working, very plucky, and wants to do better in life and make a good impression on her children so that they remember her with fondness and respect. Santos therefore works a lot at her humble house. Santos wants her children to follow a good path in life, to be honest and religious; these qualities will help her children all of their lives.

Santos takes care of the household chores, and also looks after hens and pigs. Her eldest daughter supports her in this work. With a lot of effort, Santos wakes up to take care of her duties so that everything goes well in her humble home. Santos knows that she can move forward with her commitments and her family with God's help.

Santos needs this loan in order to buy material to build a pigsty and a small chicken farm. Santos sells pork and chicken meat to local diners. She thus hopes to guarantee and income to support her family.

Santos dreams of building a decent home so that her children can live in better living conditions.

Lidis is just 19 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. She´s a really young woman who has clear what she wants to accomplish and where she’s going, that’s why her family left her in charge of the sewing family business 3 years ago, and her cousin was the one who taught her everything about it. 

This business has been running for many years and is her challenge to make her last for many more, so she works hard to accomplish that. She’s asking for a loan because she needs to buy a new sewing machine for some special production she has. 

She dreams with buying a house where she can have a comfortable life with her family. Support this young entrepreneur and loan now. 

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Caridad is 59 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. She has 2 beautiful daughters who she feels really proud of because they are great women. This woman is a single mother, reason why for many years she has been working hard. She owns a selling and preparing food business, something she learned herself.

Now she wants to increase the profits she has been making the last months, so for that she wants to invest in her business, to improve it. She’s asking for a loan so she can make some adjustments to the bar and main table of her food place, and also to buy a tent, and inputs like sodas, snacks and beers. 

She dreams with paying for the professional education for her daughters so they can succeed. Help this devoted mother and loan now. 

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Maria is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Berrio. She’s a strong woman who dreams with a better future for her and her family, that’s why she started this year a preparing a selling food business, trying to solve some economic issues that her family had. 

Her business is doing well but now she wants to do better, so she expects that with an investment the sales will increase. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy a refrigerator for the business and ice creams to sell in her place. 

She dreams with buying a house for her family. Support this woman and loan now. 

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Libis is 51 years old and is a happy married woman. She lives with her husband and 3 children, 2 sons a 1 daughter and they all love each other and believe that family is the most important thing in the world. They live in the municipality of San Pedro de Uraba, where Libis has a selling personal use products business since 2005. 

She loves selling to people, she believes is a gift and a talent she has because she’s really good at it, that’s why wants to keep improving her business, by making more sales, increasing the clients and the profits, offering more products and making the business sustainable. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more personal use products to sell like bath products, vitamins and others. 

She dreams with buying a house for her family, with paying for her children education and with leaving the business to them someday. Support her and loan now. 

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Cielo us 47 years and is happily married with a husband that she loves and respects much. She lives in the municipality of Medellin with her 2 sons. She wants to be a role model for them so they become great men. In 2012, for some economic issues she started a store in her town where she sells many products. 

Provide for the family is not an easy job, that’s why this woman needs to improve her business so the sales and the clients increase and make the business more sustainable. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy different products to sell in her store, especially daily use so she stock up.

She dreams with paying for her children education, that’s why she works so hard. Support this devoted mother and loan now.

Rifat is a 50-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son and three daughter and her husband is engaged in a scrap material recycling business.

Rifat's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle, but due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to make the bulk purchase. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can earn a good profit from his business.

Rifat is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

Parveen is a 50-year-old lady living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the motorbike and rickshaw’s body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem.
Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her son will be able to buy the moto rickshaw’s body and can his motorbike. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to meet the sudden needs of her family.

Guzal is a hardworking woman. She was born in rural area in 1986. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a master in domestic area. Guzal is a teacher in secondary school and teaches drafting. She has twenty four years of practice and wants additionally do a business. She participated at startup training provided by IMON and decided to open a new business. She wants to be a retailer and trade perfumes. Guzal is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to start her new business. She awaits your support.

Sereney is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. She has a little son who is only 4 years of age and who is her biggest motivation; the reason why she goes to work every day is to give him a good quality of life. Four years ago she decided to become independent so she created a store that she’s been running since then.

In her town there’s a lot of competition, so she tries to offer a better service so the clients prefer her. She believes this way she could improve the sales and also increase the number of clients.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy inputs to stock up like sodas, liquor and food.

She dreams of improving the conditions of her house. Support this devoted mother and lend now.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Teresita never gets tired attending to her business. Her sari-sari, or convenience store, is well known in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, for she owns the only such store in town. She earns enough in profits to sufficiently support the needs of her family.

Teresita, an active member of Kiva's field partner Paglaum MPC, is in need of capital to restock her sari-sari. She has applied for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries to sell such as noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and other consumable goods.

Merlyn owns a stall in their local public market selling footwear and other household wares. Her business is doing good so she wanted to exploit the increasing demands from her customers. Recently, she asked for a loan from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 30,000 to purchase more stock of inventories such as shoes, men's sandals, women's sandals and other items.

Elaine is single and lives in Ozamiz City. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the coop. She's requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of rice for retail in the local community. Elaine hopes to continue her business and to be able to save enough money for future emergencies.

Brenda is a 52-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married and has three children, two who are already grown up and the youngest is 20 years old.

Brenda earns a living through buying and selling fruits and vegetables to the community. She has been doing this business for the past 12 years hoping to have more successful years to come for their sustainability. Through this business, she hopes for her children to finish their studies.

So this is the reason why Brenda is asking for a bigger loan amount. She will need an amount for additional capital to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell. Aside from this, she will also buy spices to sell for additional income.

Jinefer is 41 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

Jinefer runs a farm, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jinefer requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jinefer has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to improve her farm.

In the future, Jinefer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Edna lives in Ajuy, Iloilo where she owns a small restaurant known as “carenderia”. She has been operating this for the past 15 years to earn an income and support her children. Currently, she has three children who are now already grown up. 

Edna is asking for a loan to operate her business in the same manner, continuously. She needs the loan to buy ingredients such as pork, vegetables, spices, and cooking oil. In the future, Edna wishes to expand her business so that is will become more sustainable.

Najah is 46 years old and has five children. She is married and all of her children are in school and live with her family in ‎Dairalla, which is an under-privileged area.
‎
Najah is in the agricultural business and she raises livestock and poultry and she requested a loan from Kiva to buy feed ‎and other supplies needed to raise her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for two years now and she has borrowed several times from NMB to sustain it. In the future, ‎she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.‎

Chuka, Kenya is a town that is famously known for producing the “creme de la creme” when it comes to athletes. It also has a lot of small farmers who work the land and raise animals. Unfortunately, these farmers face many challenges, including the high costs of farm inputs. Flora has experienced these challenges but she always finds a way to pull through.

Flora is from a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. She is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion for supporting her family as the primary caregiver. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize and vegetables and also keeping dairy cows. Flora has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Flora is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy unit and buy cereals to sell. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax and protects them from diseases that may arise from being exposed to harsh weather conditions, such as rain. She will use a portion of the loan to buy cereal to sell at the market in her village.

Flora believes that with this loan, she will see an increase in milk production and her living conditions will improve. Having a good dairy unit will allow her to save money, as the cost of treating her cows will decrease.

Flora awaits your kindness. Be inspired to loan to her today to keep her big smile!

Marine is so happy that her first very profitable Kiva deal ended very successfully. She lives in Noratus village of Gegharkunik region with her husband and two children. Marine graduated from agricultural college. Thanks to her education she manages her farming very cleverly and properly with the help of her husband. On her farm she has cows and calves. She sells her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, curd and also meat at the city’s wholesale market. She sells the meat to local butchers. Marine is also good in land cultivation and has a very good harvest from her vegetable garden, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, potatoes, and also apples and apricots.

This time, Marine asks for loan of 700,000 AMD because her farm cattle has a great lack of fodder. With this loan amount she must buy a lot of fodder for all her livestock on the farm.

Guldasta is a happy and hardworking 47-year-old woman from the Vakhsh district of Tajikistan.  She is married and the mother of four children.  In order to provide for her family, she is involved in two activities: she grows crops on a large piece of land and she also raises cows and steers for resale.  She enjoys  animal husbandry, an activity which she learned from her parents.

Guldasta has been raising cattle for the past seven years.  This is a profitable business, which offers a stable income.  Guldasta would like to increase her cattle headcount, so she has applied for a loan.  She wants to buy a few cows and steers because their market value is lower during the winter months than during any other period of the year.

Senora Leonor is divorced and lives with her children in the Bolivar Province, in Canton Chillanes in the Achin community.

She works raising and selling cattle. She plans to invest the loan by purchasing livestock.

She dreams to have a better personal life in the future and a better life for her family. In her free time she likes to read the Bible.

Reina, age 35, went to school through the seventh grade. She left school because of the poverty that she was experiencing. She is single. She was previously married, but they separated. She does not have children. After leaving school, Reina worked in the field with her parents. Some time after that she went to another city to do domestic work.

She currently is engaged in the business activity of selling candy twists, chocolate covered bananas, sodas, and other items. Reina buys the ingredients like chocolate, bananas, and powdered flavors for the candy twists. She then prepares them and puts them in the refrigerator so that they will be ready when the customers come to buy them. She also does agriculture jobs. She gets up at 5:00 a.m. in order to prepare, and then she goes out to work in the field.

She needs this loan to buy two heifers. Her objective is to generate abundant milk to sell. She dreams of having more livestock in order to sell milk based products.

Sen is part of the Kinh ethnic majority. She lives with her husband and her two children (one son and one daughter) in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Sen's family's lives are mainly based on cultivation and breeding. Their annual income is around 50 million VND or more. However, her two children are school aged so this income is just enough to pay for their education fees and to cover the family's living expenses. Sen wants to invest in raising chickens to get additional income for the family but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

Sen hopes that this loan will help her family invest effectively in breeding to improve her family's living standards. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

Thuy, born in 1989, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has three members, including her husband and her son. They live in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Thuy's family’s main income is from her, and her husband's, meager salary. This income is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and to save a small amount. Thuy wants to buy chickens to raise to get additional income for her family but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

Thuy hopes that this loan will help her family invest effectively in chicken breeding with high productivity, which will produce additional income for her family. Additionally, thanks to this loan, her family will have a good life.

Kulumkan successfully repaid her loan, having used it for the intended purpose, and she is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. Kulumkan has eight cows, 15 sheep, and a horse, and her monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business, she applied for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy dairy cows to increase her sales of organic milk. Kulumkan intends to develop her business, which will lead to an increase in capital and allow her to save money to renovate her home.

Lily is in retailing business for 10 years. Her business is gaining good income knowingly she owns the only store in their place. Recently, she approached Paglaum MPC for additional capital to restock sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others.

Naheed is a 41-year-old married woman living with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been driving a rickshaw near the airport. He picks the passengers up from the airport and drops them off at their specific destinations.

A few days ago, he got in a road accident while driving, and his rickshaw got serious damages. He wants to fix the damages and some engine maintenance as well. Therefore, Naheed requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. She hopes that through this amount her husband will be able to repair his rickshaw so he can drive it again.

Naheed belongs to a poor family; her husband is the only single earner. Her family members live in very miserable conditions.

Naheed seems very glad and thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Ghulam Fatima is helping her husband in sewing socks and then selling them in the market. Her husband wants to increase the flow his production but does not have cash in hand for purchasing clothing for sewing socks.

This is the reason she has requested a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can purchase raw material for sewing socks. In this way she will be enable for providing good meals, cloth and education.

She hopes this loan will bring positive changes among her family member. Ghulam Fatima would be very thankful to all Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

The purchase of beauty products and manual tools for manicures and pedicures are the reasons that Sandra is before the Kiva community to ask for financial support to buy these items.

She is a 35 years old and she started her activity out of economic necessity, faced with a lack of employment opportunities, as well as due to her perseverance, motivation and eagerness to get her 12 year old daughter ahead. She dreams of seeing her graduate from college, and she will do everything within her reach to make this dream come true.

That is why she is fervently asking for support, because with this investment, she can improve sales, quality of service and the number of customers she can serve in a day.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Adairis is a 38 year old woman. She is asking for a loan to start a beauty salon business in er house. She needs to to do a lot of work on it but she doesn't have enough capital to cover all of the necessary expenses to have a beauty salon. If Adairis receives the support, she will invest it in buying a beauty salon chair, a sink, a mirror and salon tools.

With her business, she hopes one day to buy a house to live comfortably.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Maria is a hardworking 54 year old woman who works preparing food for special events such as marriages, christenings, first communions, among other events. She is separated and has a son who is already an adult. She started her business due to financial need, because she had to take care of household expenses; but since she became independent, she has been able to keep up with her debts and have the ability to support her household. Thanks to her excellent preparation, Maria has gained a number of customers and good recommendations. She has everything prepared to achieve business growth, but she does not have enough capital to buy the necessary inputs and ingredients to cook more food with the goal of assisting in many events on a day, which would result in better earnings for her. For this reason, she is requesting a considerable amount of the loan to buy an industrial oven, pots, dishes, equipment, and to have the capital to buy raw material, which she buys the day before production so that all her products are fresh. If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Rosalina has been running her convenience store for almost 15 years. She opened a small store with initial capital of PHP 650 that she had on hand after her wedding.

She invested that little amount buying consumable goods that are commonly used in a simple household, and rolled up her proceeds. From that time on, she has expanded her little business and added more products such as liquor and cigarettes, deodorants, over-the-counter medicines, and even rice and corn grains for human consumption. Now she also sells animal feed.

Rosalina recalls that her dreams of being a boss of her own business have come true. However, she said that this has been made possible because of the assistance of Paglaum MPC that she nurtured for a longer time.

She continuously provides her immediate market with their needs. She asks for a loan of PHP 14,900 to restock the store with grocery items, confectioneries, condiments and other things.

Rhea Agnes is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the municipality of Lower loboc, Oroquieta City with her family. She is married and has two children whom she wants to raise well. 

She and her husband operate a small restaurant known as a “carenderia” to the locals. Rhea Agnes is good at cooking, so they managed to start this small restaurant business. They have now been operating for three years. 

This is the reason why she is asking for a loan from GDMPC. Rhea Agnes needs an extra amount of money to buy new kitchen utensils. 

In the future, she dreams of improving this business for their sustainability.

Rosell is in the seaweed-production business. She has been involved in this business for 15 years already. 

Rosell makes good income from her business, and she is continuously increasing her production to meet orders. 

She signed up for membership to Paglaum MPC to access additional capital for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase strings, bamboo poles and seaweed.

Jean is 38 years old, married, and has school-age children. She owns and operates a convenience store in her community. This business enables her to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family. 

Jean recalls that she started with capital of only 3,000 PHP, which she obtained through a loan from Paglaum MPC. She successfully repaid her loan and managed to roll on the capital. 

Now that she needs to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, confectioneries, condiments, detergent bars, shampoo, beauty soap and others, Jean is asking for another loan from the cooperative.

Sandra is 26 years old and lives in a house she owns where she has lived for her entire life. To support her household she works at a company near her community. Thanks to this work she is able to earn money and thus meet her basic needs. In order to improve her quality of life, Sandra is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in blocks, sand, cement and iron and to pay for the labor to build a retaining wall. In this way she will be able to have a better lifestyle with more security.

Angel is a 51-year-old man who is about to take a big step in his life, and you can help him. He needs financial support to gather all the money required to buy an automobile repair shop. This will be a radical change in his life. His goal with this acquisition is to improve his family's living conditions.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Dora is an affectionate 48-year-old woman. She is a smiling and disciplined woman who works making food at home. She has three teenage children, and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, with whom she shares the home expenses.

Dora is a restless worker: she works twelve hours every day. She is applying for a loan to buy a gas stove, improve her firewood oven, and buy ingredients and supplies to prepare meals and lunches.

This loan will help her to improve her sales, attract more customers, increase her profits, and formalize her business.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

39-year-old Nelisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, cooking oil, eggs, assorted canned goods, beverages and toiletries. She is married to a vendor. They have two children ages 13 and 18 years old respectively. For more than 5 years, she has been running as sari-sari(variety) store, serving neighbors in her community.

Nelisa is asking for a loan to acquire additional capital to in vest in beverages, condiments, toiletries and other goods. This will enable her to provide a variety of stock and attract more buyers to purchase. Thus her income will slowly improve and she will be able to provide her children with nutritious meals.

Nelisa dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable to support the education of her children.

Liza Jane never gets tired of running her business. Her sari-sari store (convenience store) is known in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte because she owns the only store in their town. She's making good sales from her business that sufficiently support the needs of her family. Because she is in need of additional capital to restock the sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments, and other items, she has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC where Liza Jane is an active member.

Rosa lives with her husband and children in the Bolivar province in the Chillanes region in the Achin community.

She works raising and selling cattle. She states that the loan will be used to invest in the purchase of cattle of a specific breed and so accomplish only having that type of cattle.

In her free time she makes springs and likes to go to Carnaval.

A $3.000 loan will help Silva to pay for 650 packages of fodder, 2.5 ton of combine fodder and to buy a cow to improve their farm. Silva is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two daughters in Akner village. Silva’s husband’s parents live in the neighborhood.

Silva got engaged in agriculture five years ago, as soon as her husband returned from the army. After getting married, they sold sheep, which Silva’s husband kept on his farm, to buy a house. They sell the products in the region of Goris. Now they want to buy sheep again, as that’s a more profitable way of agriculture, and that way this startup family will gain better income for their little children’s care.

They will use the profit from their business to improve living conditions for their children. Silva is very hopeful that the startup families like theirs will receive your attention and support.

Gina is a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC where she access the needed capital of her food business. She makes palatable snacks and other food products that she delivers to various schools and establishments. Her business had supported the needs of her family aside from the monthly allotment that she receives from her husband working abroad.

Recently, she approached the cooperative for the much needed amount to finish the construction of her dream house. The amount of PHP 50,000.00 to purchase construction materials such as bags of cement, sand, gravel, iron steel rod and pay for labor cost in house completion.

Lorencia is in retailing business 20 years. She is selling various consumable goods and basic household goods in the local community. Her business was supported by her loans from Paglaum MPC. Recently, she asks for a loan for to restock sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others.

Marissa runs a store that caters motorcycle parts like tires, chains, side mirrors and other motor cycle spare parts. She is a married woman with four children, whom two are still attending school. Together with her family, she resides in the town of Dulag.

She has requested a loan to buy additional stocks of spare parts. These will fill her store with additional goods to offer to her respective customers. She could then start to improve her earnings and slowly gain profit.

In the future, she is hoping that she could expand her current source of income to support the schooling of her children.

Yolanda runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells a range of goods like snack foods, cooking oil, beverages and canned goods.

She  is a married woman with one dependent. She has been running a variety store for quite a period of time.  Together with her family, she lives in the rural town of Mayorga.

She would like to boost her income and to be able to serve her customers well. She joined Kiva's field partner CEVI to meet her financial needs. Yolanda has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more supplies for the store, such as coffee, shampoo, eggs and condiments.

María is asking for a new loan because her business requires it; it will help her to pay to harvest her basic grains and to buy sugar, flour, eggs, etc., to continue making bread to sell and to do her farming work on time. She hopes to always attend to her customers in the best possible manner and to have sufficient income to subsist along with her loved ones. Using the previous loan for her business she was able to have raw material to cover the demands of the holiday season and to give her customers good service.

The woman above, who some years ago lost her lovely husband, needs financing support. Her name is Tulgon. She is 54 years old. She has two children and she is the main bread winner in the family. She lives in a village.  

More than 26 years ago she began her own business in farming. She grows crops and vegetables such as potatoes, onions, wheat and maize. She works every day from early morning until late evening on her own land. She knows her situation very well and has great experience. Since her husband died she has been managing the business alone. 

She sells her harvest at the local market. She has her own customers as her harvest is of high quality. She wants to develop the business further and to create good profits. 

With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 11,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. She has many perfect plans for the future and tries to realize them. She awaits your support and mercy.

Beatriz lives with her mother and son in the province of Bolivar in the Chillanes Canton in the community of Chimbo.

She raises and sells cattle and claims she needs the loan to buy livestock. Her dream is to give her family a better quality of life. In her free time she enjoys sports and the carnival.

Precila is 63 years old and has two children. She has coco land that she cultivates, and she integrates other commodities for more income. Precila plans to disperse goats on her farm. She approached Paglaum MPC to buy more head of goats for dispersal. She wants to take advantage of the high demand for goats for butchering. In the future, Precila hopes to sustain her business and would love to open an eatery.

For eighteen years, Liza and her husband has earned a living by selling food (snacks) to the community of San Dionisio, Iloilo. She and her family lived a simple life in that town. Liza is a 41-year-old woman and has four children, two of these children are already grown up and the other two are 14 and 11 years old.

Her goal in life is to improve their business for their sustainability. With this, she is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, sugar and materials for packaging. In this way, Liza and her husband will be able to improve their earnings and save money for future needs.

Verginia is a sari-sari (variety) store owner, where she sells variety of goods. She is 46 years old and a married woman. She and her family live in a town San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has been running her store for three years to earn an income. It is the business that sustains them every day.

That is why Verginia hopes to improve this livelihood for their sustainability. With this, she is requesting a loan to buy stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, food seasoning, snack foods, mosquito repellent, drinks and rice to sell. In this way, Verginia was able to improve her store and make it more productive.

For five years, Eva is engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the town of San Dionisio, Iloilo; while her husband is working hard as a laborer. They are doing this to provide the needs of their children. Thus, they have six children; three who are already grown up and the other three are still dependent. 

Eva’s future plan is to have enough money to send all her children to school. She dreams for them all to get a degree and have better lives someday. To do this, first she needs to improve her business. So this is the reason why she is in need of a loan. She will use the money to buy more fruits and vegetables. Aside from this, she will also buy food seasoning and dried noodles to sell.

Marilyn is from the town of Dulag. She is 50 years old, married and has eight children, of whom two are still attending school. She is a fish vendor. She sold fish to neighbors and locals in her community. She also raises hogs and also does farming works, too. She grows and sells rice.
She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Marilyn is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and pesticides. With these, it could help yield bountiful harvest and able to gain higher earnings. Slowly she could now start to expand and able to manage her finances to become stable.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

Yolanda is a hardworking woman known in her community for the different jobs she has, such as raising pigs, growing basic grains, and selling basic supplies from her stall. She enjoys doing all these activities. Yolanda is married and has a 10-year old son who is in grade 4. Her husband works away from home so Yolanda runs the household and the business so she can fulfill all her commitments.

She wishes to invest in more pigs and basic grains and thus improve her business. Then in the future she will be able to sell the animals at higher prices. Her hope is to maintain sales so she can have the opportunity to do better financially and help her family get ahead.

Yolanda's hope for the future is to continue working so that her son will have better life and educational opportunities.

The young woman with her face pixelated in the photo is 25 and lives in a high-risk zone. She has been raising pigs for two years, and sells them in various markets near her home. With the sales generated, she is able to cover her household expenses. She lives in her own home with her partner and son. She is requesting a loan to buy pig feed, so she can continue raising them and increase her income.

This young woman's face is pixelated because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has sold pupusas for 2 years. Her business is located in her residence and thanks to her work and her husband's help, they are able to get ahead. She lives in her own home with her husband. She is asking for a loan again to buy crackings, beans, fresh cheese, corn and other ingredients, since it is going well in her work and she has had good income.

María is a 38 year old woman who began producing garments two years ago using rented equipment. She has one employee and a little over three years of experience in the market with fixed clients and good growth projections.

María started her business with the goal of increasing her income enough to cover her household expenses, have a good quality of life, remodel her house, and achieve financial freedom, among other goals. She is a hardworking woman who is requesting this loan so that she might buy her own sewing machine, since she currently rents her equipment.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

Anabel is a woman who divorced several years ago. When it happened, she returned to her parents' home. She has an 11 year old daughter who is in 6th grade.

Her biggest wish is to have her own home, because that way, she can offer her daughter and her self the security she needs. They are very excited to have a home to be able to get ahead, enjoy their own garden, and for Anabel to leave something to her daughter.

When she got divorced, a lot of people humiliated her and made her feel bad. However, she defines herself as a worker ant, and she says that now those people can believe what she has achieved.

Help Anabel make her dream come true, to fight day to day, and be able to have her own home where she can watch movies and paint with her daughter.

Aracely has two children, Angeli who is in pre-school and Frida who loves dancing and theater.

For several years they have lived in a rented house. Her greatest desire is to have the peace of mind of owning her own home, instead of renting one that the landlord can reclaim at any time.

Aracely works as an hourly employee at an apple packaging factory. Her father also helps her pay for the rent.

Aracely's greatest desire is to build a house for her daughters.

Claudia works as a secretary at the mine in her community. She is divorced, and is now the primary source of support for her little daughter, Ingrid, who wants to be a pediatrician or veterinarian when she grows up. She has struggled a great deal because she does not own her own home, they have had to move from one place to another or they have had to rent a house. These changes are upsetting for her daughter, since as soon as she starts to get used to a new place, they have to move again.

Another problem they face is they live on the second floor, and when it rains, the stairway gets very slippery because it's made of metal.

Claudia would love to go back to school to get a degree in ecological engineering or animal husbandry. For now, her main priority is to have security, both physical and emotional, a safe place to live, her own home.

Help Claudia to provide a safe home for her daughter.

Isidra is a 29-year-old married woman with three children from Dimiao, Bohol. She has owned a sari-sari (variety) store for seven years. Isidra sells commodities like rice, sugar, soft drinks and canned goods. She earns PHP7500 per month. Locals usually take merchandise on credit. With this, she is struggling to refill her shelves on time.

She requested a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like soft drinks, liquor and e-feed. Isidra hopes that her business will prosper so that she will be able to raise her family's livelihood and uplift their present living condition.

Lanie is 53 years old and a house wife from Poblacion II, Oroquieta City. Her husband works abroad for their bright future. She decided to sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and enjoy the perks and benefits including insurance services and loan products.

Recently, she avails a loan to purchase bags of cement, paints and pay for labor cost in house repair. She hopes to make necessary renovations on their house for a good dwelling.

Cecilia is 42-years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has worked making and selling tortillas for 11 years, and thanks to her job she has been able to get ahead with the household expenses. She wants to improve her home, cementing the floor and making minor repairs, but what she earns from her sales is not enough to do this. For that reason she is asking for a loan to buy needed construction materials. This way she can have a more comfortable and clean home.

The young woman who face is obscured because she is 25 years old and lives in a high risk part of the city, has been selling eyeglasses and cosmetics for 11 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. With the earnings she gets, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. The young woman lives with her aunt in their own home.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as cosmetics, nail polishes, hair clips, shampoos, hair dyes, eyeglasses, etc. she that can keep selling and thereby improve her income.

Amparo works as a domestic employee. Her son is a laborer. He gives all of his earnings to Amparo to help out at home. Right now, they are renting a small house and this is a big problem because almost all of their income goes into paying rent. That is why her biggest wish is to own her one home.

Her biggest dream is to grow old and be able to offer her son a better place to live.

Help Amparo and her son Gio make their dream come true of living together in their own home.

María is 63 years old and lives in the town of Nemocón. She started her businesses in the year 1985. She is a distributor of milk and sells drinks. She opens every day at 3:00 p.m. and closes at 10:00 p.m. The passers-by, neighbors and workers of that area arrive at her business to buy carafes of milk and to drink sodas, malts, and domestic and imported beers.

María needs to increase her milk production. For that reason she is applying for her first Kiva loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to invest the proceeds in two dairy cows, and in the purchase of cases of various drinks, given that the demands of her customers are increasing and her capacity is insufficient. Her dreams are to increase her earnings, and to travel in order to know different places and enjoy herself as much as possible.

Rhealyn is a 36-year-old woman who owned a sari-sari (varieties) store in Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has two children. Her oldest child is 17 years old while her youngest child is 14 years old. Her husband is a fisherman and works hard to provide the needs of their family.

Rhealyn has been running her store business for three years. She is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, chips, biscuits, candies and drinks. Other part of her loan is to buy dried fish. Definitely, she has other business opportunities. In this way, Rhealyn could improve her store and her earnings as well.

Ruth is a sari-sari (variety) store owner and has been proficiently running this business for almost six years to earn a living, while her husband does fishing. She and her family live in Concepcion, Iloilo.

Ruth is a 58-year-old woman who dreams of a business improvement for her family. She wishes to have a better and more comfortable means of living. Because of this, Ruth is asking for a bigger amount of loan for additional capital to improve her store.

From this loan, she will buy commodities such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, flour, powdered chocolate drink and milk, chips, candies, bread, laundry soap and toiletries. Part of her requested amount is to buy bamboo for their fishing.

Teresa is a 43-year-old woman from the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has two children ages 18 and 9 years old. She earns a living together with his husband through fishing. They have been proficiently doing this business for 15 years. Aside from this, Teresa is also engaged in selling frozen foods to the community.

She is asking a bigger amount of loans to buy fishing nets. They need this to help them enhance their catch. Other part of her loan amount is for additional capital to buy frozen products such as sweetened meat, chorizo and hotdogs. In the future, Teresa wishes to be productive and more sustainable.

Glinda has started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has manage to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay.

Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

Corina, 49, lives in her own home with her family. She has worked selling sea food for 15 years and is able to cover some of her household expenses with her sales. She wants to improve her home by building a wall in the place shown in the photo. As she does not have enough capital, she is requesting a loan to buy the necessary construction materials. This will allow her to have a larger home.

Corazon never gets tired in attending her business. Her sari-sari store (convenience store) is known in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, for she owns the only store in their place. She's making good sales in her business so that she sufficiently supports the needs of her family.

Since she is in need of additional capital to restock her sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments, and other items, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where Corazon is an active member.

Elsi, 52 years old, lives in her own house in the company of her husband and her 24-year-old son. She is a hard-working woman who, with a lot of effort, two years ago managed to establish her own store which she tends with a lot of friendliness, which has made her have many customers in her community who know her and recommend her. In this way, she generates her income with which she provides the basic supplies and expenses of the utilities in the home. In addition, she gets the support with some household expenses from her husband and son who offer their services in private businesses. Elsi wants to invest in her business purchasing more of a variety of products to stock her store and be able to offer her customers new products and for this she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of products such as juice, dairy products, cereals, detergent, basic grains (corn, beans, rice), etc. to stock her business with new products.

Varduhi lives in the village of Baghramyan, in the Baghramyan region, with her large family. She has four children and five cute little grandchildren who sing in a choir.

Varduhi has a shop and bakery in the local area, and is engaged in trading activities. At first she had a store where she sold only products, but she has now enlarged her business and started to sell prepared goods as well. Varduhi says that her business isn't differentiated from the other businesses in her area, and the competition in the market doesn’t allow her to increase her income.

A loan of $3,000 will help Varduhi to purchase food to stock her store. With the help of this loan, she won’t have to downgrade her market, and will be able to increase her income and better provide for her grandchildren.

Hiyam, a 57-year-old married mother of two, has run her convenience store since August 2012. She is well known in her region and has a good reputation. She also offers special products, with encouraging, affordable prices. Hiyam is always working hard to expand and develop her business but, unfortunately, her increasing living expenses limit her from taking this step forward.

Today, Hiyam is acquiring her second loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. Her first step towards developing and increasing her business capital was through a previously acquired loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, and it was invested in increasing her merchandise with special summer beverages and special offer items. Hiyam's current requested loan will be used to increase her business merchandise with special winter products. She hopes to stay capable of increasing and diversifying her business products and replying to her customers' increasing requests.

Bibijamol, age 50, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives in the Vakhsh district with her husband, her two sons, her daughters-in-law, and grand-children.  Her husband raises livestock.  Her oldest son is a migrant worker in Russia.  As for Bibijamol herself, she has been involved in agriculture (growing mostly vegetables) for the past six years.  Her husband and youngest son help her with her farming activity.

Bibijamol owns a large private plot of land and she is getting ready for the next planting season.  For this reason, she is taking a loan which will be used to buy seeds and a large quantity of mineral fertilizers.  She is hoping to get a good spring harvest and to make enough profits to improve her living conditions.

Tukhik lives in Meghri town with her husband. Their two children live separately in different town. 

Tukhik and her husband run a cafe in the center of Meghri town. They started the business 2 years ago. At that time it was very small and over those two years, they were able to enlarge the cafe. Tukhik and her husband work at the cafe and welcome their clients with lots of love and care. The requested loan will help them to purchase  two air conditioners and cover renovation work for the kitchen in cafe. 

Tukhik and her husband hope to receive lenders' support and will be very happy to welcome lenders in their cafe one day.

Buon, 57 years old, is an ethnic Thai woman. She has been in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since 2006. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from the meager retired salaries of her and her husband, so it is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount from that income.
