At 19 years old, Fatima has been making a living selling cereals for two years. She is very happy that she is able to support her family. Fatima lives with uncle and aunt at their house. She has lived there for a many years and is content with the arrangement.

Fatima wants to build a room in the house. To do so, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron bars. With this room, she will have her own space where she can relax.

This young woman's face has been pixelated because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has a small store set up in her home and has been in business for several years. The profits she earns cover some of the household expenses.

She lives in her own house with her life partner and son. The loan she is requesting is to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. to earn more income and improve her quality of life.

Angeles is 58 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Angeles has a general store business in the Philippines. Angeles requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Angeles has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Angeles would like to save money to expand her business.

Verónica is 26-years old and lives with her partner and two children, ages 2 and 5, in a house on their property which she feels very happy about. She works selling items of clothing, as well as loaning her services in a large store where she does her sales on the weekends.

Verónica wants to improve the roof on her home because it is falling apart. She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheets, poles, pins, nails and wire to improve the roof and part of the walls in her house.

Anna is 47 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Anna has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Anna requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen food to resell.

Anna has been in this business for six years. In the future, Anna would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

Sara is a woman of 53 years of age who lives with her father and her 22-year-old son, whom she has managed to raise with much sacrifice. She is a hard-working woman who offers her services as a cook. In addition, she sells beauty products by catalog.

Sara wants to invest in catalog beauty products, for which she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in lotions, deodorants, make-up, etc., for her business of selling beauty products.

Jane is a single woman with four children. She describes herself as being committed. She operates a retail business, selling potatoes, onions and other vegetables. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. Her biggest business challenge is the high cost of products.

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use this loan, for 100,000 Kenyans shillings, to buy more stock of potatoes, onions and other vegetables. She hopes, in the future, she will have increased profits. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

Maria, 30, lives in her own house with her 2 children.  She's had a business making and selling tortillas for 5 years, a business that she started with her own capital.  With her earnings from this business, she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn in 100 pound sacks.  This way she can continue with her sales and generate a good income.

Martha is 53 years old. She lives in her own home home with her husband and their daughter. For 17 years she has made and sold pupusas. She started with her own capital. Her business is located in her residence in a very busy area. With what she makes from her sales she is able to pay for some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy cracklings, cheese curd, beans, corn and other ingredients so she can continue with her work that generates good income for her.

Experia is a widowed 64-year-old mother of eight children. Experia works very hard to provide for them.

Experia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. Experia requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, bread, cooking oil, coffee, cereals, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Experia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Ana studied until the third grade of elementary school. She is married and her partner is a pensioner. She has two children, but only one lives with her now because he is a special child, and the other is in a relationship and has her own home. Ana also has a grandson who is studying and living with her; so three people depend on her.

Ana has worked with the store she built for more than ten years. She learned this business through her own initiative and decided to make pupusas to sell on the weekends. She also receives remittances from the USA. Previously she only did domestic work. Her store business is at her home where she lives. She travels by bus into town to buy the products necessary for her business. Her husband supports her and her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 6.30 pm from Monday to Sunday.

Ana will buy products to stock her store, which will greatly improve her business because she will be able to have a variety of products to offer to her customers. This will allow her to have a better quality of life. She feels pleased because she has the opportunity to continue working thanks to her current loan and previous loans, because she can get along working with the loans. Now she has more products and a griddle to make pupusas that previously she did not.

Her dreams are to continue working very hard in order to be able to live a little better and to always have her store stocked. This loan will help her achieve her dreams, and with her earnings she will continue buying products and paying back the loan, since her objective is to comply with the duties of her loan so that she can keep borrowing.

El Crucero is a solidarity group made up of three successful micro-entrepreneurs, led by 27 year old Virginia who is married with two children of 10 and 7 years of age.

She has been the owner of a grocery store for two years, where she offers a wide variety of products, she relies on the support of her sisters who help her deal with clients.

With the goal of growing the business, she is asking for a 5th loan in order to invest in buying rice, sugar, chicken, oil and oats.

With the previous loan she was able to improve her home and buy a freezer.

The second member is 36 year old Jessenia who is a stylist, the third member is 48 year old Migdalia, who earns a living selling food.

Olga is 46 years old and is a micro-entrepreneur from the municipality of Nemocón. She works selling hardware products and construction materials. She began the business 16 years ago with the help of her spouse and after they separated she continued to be in charge of the business and her home. She is the mother of three daughters aged 26, 20 and 17 years old and her main longing is to finish paying their studies so they can become competent professionals. She opens her business every day of the week from 7 am until closing at 7 pm. She is very committed and dedicated to achieving excellent results.

Olga is making a request for a loan from Kiva, an opportunity to access the world of financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will stock her business with gallons of paint to sell during the December season, a time when her clients want to do some remodeling of their homes and take advantage of that to paint the house.

Olga wants to continue working with great responsibility and commitment in her hardware store as she has been doing and offer well-being to her daughters.

Gulnoza is a polite woman. She has five children. She has been working for 10 years in farming. She has good experience in this sphere.

In her childhood she tried to help her parents and to learn something from them. She loved working with them and her parents admired her work.

She now has four hectares of land. She wants to enlarge her business and earn a good income. She wants to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. She needs to borrow money, and is asking for a loan of 13,000 TJS. She awaits your help and mercy.

Mrs Lợi is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years. Lợi lives in Trieu Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

In 2014, Lợi joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Lợi has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Lợi is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her solidarity group.

The main hardship that Lợi faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby fish to resell.

With her business profit, Lợi hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to do well in school.

Mrs Sinh is 54 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising pig and farming rice, for more than 10 years. Sinh lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Sinh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future. This is Sinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Sinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find a good job.

Mrs Lan is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has had a retail business selling cake, sweet, suger, milk, etc. for 8 years. Lan lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Lan is a reputable person in the community, she is the leader of her solidarity group.

The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, suger, milk etc. to resell. With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to do well in school.

Mrs Thùy is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 4 years. Thùy lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thùy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future. In 2013, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thùy has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of the "Keep smile" group, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Thùy hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

Mrs Vân is 21 years old and she is married with no children. She has had a retail business selling clothes for 3 years. Vân lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

Vân is a reputable person in the community. Although this is her first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members agreed to vote for her to be the leader of "Funny store" solidarity group.

The main hardship that Vân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell. With her business profit, Vân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to build a new house.

Mrs Tình is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has had a stall selling fruit for more than 10 years. Tình lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

Tình is a reputable person in the community. Although this is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members agreed to vote for her to be the leader of the solidarity group.

The main hardship that Tình faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. With her business profit, Tình hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to buy land of her own.

Mrs Luận is 51 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has worked in agriculture raising livestock for more than 10 years. Luận lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this region often suffers from natural disasters such as floods and drought.

The main hardship that Luận faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. In 2013, Luận joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business.

Luận has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Thôn 4- Hoằng Thịnh, which consists of 4 members. With her business profit, Luận hopes to maintain a successful business, to build a new house and for her business to do well.

This woman is a native of the city of Tarija. She is single but has a small son who she has been able to raise by herself, giving him the moral and economic support that he needs.
She is currently working in Clínica Varicent on prevention and marketing.
She still lives in her parents' home, and they help her to raise her son. She needs economic resources for a surgical procedure that she must have. The surgery is to reconstruct her abdominal wall as it is giving her gastric problems that currently affect her work performance.
She does not have her own home but has yearned to have one for a long time so that she could offer he little son better living conditions. She needs to be in good health to achieve her many dreams.

Mrs Lân is 50 years old. She is married and has six children. She has operated a food stall, selling fish for more than 10 years.

Lân lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her income is lower than the national average income. Moreover, this job is unstable. Lân's circumstances are the most difficult in this group. Her husband passed away seven years ago. Her family is living in a small house in the village. She must work hard for four children to go to school. The youngest child is eight years old.

Lân's main income is from her fish stall. In addition, she tries to do a part-time job, to be a worker for environmental company. The main hardship that Lân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting loans to purchase more fish to resell. With the business profit, Lân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids to have schooling.

Catalina is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellín. She’s a happy married woman and loves her husband more than anybody, and he has become in a big motivation for her. In 2002 she started her own business, a selling place where she commercializes different kinds of products like food, accessories, clothes and others.

She wants to improve her business so that she can improve her sales and get more profits. She also wants to be more competitive in the market because there are a lot of other stores like hers, but she knows she can offer better service and products with high quality. She’s asking for a loan so that she can buy inputs, toys especially, for this Christmas season.

Catalina has big expectations for the future of her business; she wants to see it as a successful and recognized business. She also wants to improve the condition of her house. Help Catalina with the loan she needs.

Sandra is 34 years old and is a happy married woman. She lives in the municipality of Medellin with her beloved husband and her two sons of 15 and 11 years of age. She has a beautiful family to whom she hopes she can give a good quality of life. That’s the reason why she decided she wants to start her own business, a bar/store where people can buy products and also hang out.

She hopes her business will give her good profits so that she can keep investing in it to make it better and so that she can also provide for her family, the main reason for having the business. She’s asking for a loan so that she can start her bar/store business and buy inputs to begin with and some chairs and tables for the place.

Sandra dreams of paying for her children's education so they become professionals in the future. She also wants to improve the condition of her house. Help Sandra to start her business on the right foot and to give her family a good life; loan now.

Gloria is 35 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. Some years ago she took some classes in order to be able to create her own business. Now she’s the owner of a beauty salon where she delivers services such as hair styling and cutting and also sells hair treatments.

This business has made her a strong and confident woman who wants to take the world by storm. Now she wants to improve her salon by increasing her clientele and thus her sales as well. She’s asking for a loan so that she can buy a new chair for the salon and some treatments to keep selling them.

Gloria has many dreams, but her biggest one is to buy a house where her family can have a great life. Help Gloria to accomplish her dream and to improve her business with just a loan.

Norbi is 51 years old and lives in Medellin. She has always loved to serve to people, and that’s the main reason why she opened a store two years ago where she sells many products. People like going to her store because of the good service, and this has allowed her to provide for her family. She wants to accomplish great things, including improve her business by increasing sales and clients and, with them, her profits. She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies for the holiday season when demand for products like food and drinks is highest. Norbi dreams of having her own house, and is sure her business will allow her to do this someday. You can contribute to her success by helping with this loan.

Rosa is 62 years old and she lives in her own home with her husband. Rosa has worked selling dairy products (cheese, cream, soft cheese and cottage cheese) for many years. Her business is located in her home. Thanks to her job, she can cover some of the expenses of her home. Rosa is seeking a new loan to purchase more wholesale dairy products because her sales are going well and this way she can obtain better economic earnings.

Necta owns a clothes store and sells men's and women's clothes.  She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of two children who go to school.  Thanks to her small business, Necta is able to feed her family.  Necta's dream is to expand her store and increase her income.  She is taking this loan to buy a stock of dresses and jeans.

Melinda is 45 years old. She owns a motorcycle which she uses for transport business.  She also does coconut farming and raises hogs for a living, alongside her husband.  She is asking for a loan to buy feed and fertilizer to meet the needs of her business.  Her earnings from the business will be used to buy food for the family, pay for school fees of her youngest child and reinvest in the same business.

Mrs Hà is 48 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising pigs for more than 10 years.
Hà lives in the Tinh Gia district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village.  There is a limited market in this region. 
The main hardship that Hà faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.
This is Hà first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hà hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

Mrs Ngoan is 59 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has had a service to peel rice (separate the rice from the husk) for more than 10 years. Ngoan lives in Trieu Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

In 2014, Ngoan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Ngoan has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Ngoan is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her solidarity group.

The main hardship that Ngoan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more equipment to peel rice. With her business profit, Ngoan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to do well in school.

Mrs Phiến is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years. Phiến lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

In 2011, Phiến joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Phiến has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Phiến is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her "Solidarity" group.

The main hardship that Phiến faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. With her business profit, Phiến hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business and to buy land of her own.

This young woman, whose face we have blurred as she is 29 years old and lives in a dangerous area, has had a mill for making boiled corn located in her home for the past four years. She has many customers and with what she earns from her business she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She lives in her own house with her life-partner. She is asking for another loan, this time in order to improve the premises where she has her business and also to be able to purchase building supplies necessary to take care of her customers better and continue with her work.

Maria is 60 years old and lives in her own home with her partner. For 19 years, she has had a small store in her home. She has many clients because of her good price and kindness with selling. With her earnings from her sales, she succeeds in covering some household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, sweets, sweet bread, etc. Thus, she will be able to have more income for a better quality of life.

It was 10 years ago that Marling started to work selling fruits and vegetables. Her son is her main helper in the business. Little by little she has gotten ahead.

It is for that reason that she is requesting a loan to increase her income and to buy more fruits and vegetables. With the obtained earnings, she will be able to improve the infrastructure of her store.

Martha is a woman who has succeeded in getting ahead with the business of selling clothing and shoes. She started this business three years ago and her daughters are her main supporters. She wants to strengthen her business and expand into different areas. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase household appliances and a variety of merchandise, and in that way supply the demand of her customers. Martha will be able to make improvements in her home with the income obtained.

Rosa is 55 years old and lives with her son in a house that she owns. She has earned her living selling dairy products and natural ice pops for six years. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers, especially her neighbors. With the earnings she obtains, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Rosa is requesting a loan for the purchase of more products at wholesale so that she can continue with her sales in order to have a better income.

Maria is a 56-year-old widow who lives in her own house with her two daughters. For some 20 years now, she has operated a small store in her place of residence. Maria has many customers due to her good prices and the friendliness she displays while selling goods. The earnings she obtains is sufficient to cover some of her household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan for purchasing more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet breads, etc., in order to earn a better income and enjoy a better quality of life.

Elvia is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her parents. She has a cell phone repair and accessories sales business that she has had for 5 years. Elvia has many customers because of the quality of the products and with the profit she obtains, she is able to take care of some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cell phone accessories and spare parts in bulk in order to continue with her sales and be able to gain better economic income.

Farzana is 49 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in her own house with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan. For several years her husband has been running a small shop selling dry fruits. The shop is located in their place of residence. He sells all kinds of dry fruits. With what he makes from his sales, he manages to make ends meet and cover household expenses.

Farzana is asking once again for a loan to purchase dry fruits such as grams, coconut, peaches, peanuts and dry grapes, etc., to be able to stock her husband’s shop and have better revenue. Farzana and her family will be thankful to the KIVA lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

Susana, an entrepreneur, has owned a small grocery store in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She and her family have lived in this place for a long time now. Usually attached to one's home, the small grocery store is called a "sari-sari," which means variety.

Susana's business consists of selling vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, milo sachets, powdered detergent, coffee, matches, canned corned beef, beef loaves, sardines, creamer and shampoo. The business is the source of her daily income.

Susana needs to make further investments in her store, however, she lacks the funds to do so because of her children's school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned food, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, candies, chips, detergent, sugar and seasonings. With the loan, Susana will be able to augment her stock to attract more customers, thus giving her the chance of increasing her sales.

Susana hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable. The income generated will pay for the school fees of her children who are nine, twelve and fourteen years old.

Fatuma is a married mother of two school-going kids. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are stock purchases in addition to food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour in a shop to the general public. She faces a major challenge of lack of working capital to run her business. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil to expand her current business.

She joined Yehu to have access to loans in order to boost her business

Maira, 36, lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She has worked in the production and sale of tortillas for two years and she began with her own resources. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase corn for quintals and lime powder so she can continue with the production of tortillas and thus can have a better income to have a better quality of life.

Reina is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. She has owned a business selling fruits and vegetables for 20 years. The business, located near her place of residence, was started with her own capital. With her earnings, she manages to pay some of her household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables so she can continue selling and therefore improve her income.

Yuri is 32 years old and is a happily married woman. She lives with her husband in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. She has two children, a daughter who is 6 and a son who is 14. She’s a devoted mother and wife who works hard to provide for her family, that’s why, in 2006 she started a variety store where she sells many different products. There's always something new in her location.

She’s very grateful with her aunt who was the one who taught her how to manage her store. Now she wants to go further with it, so people get to know the business and appreciate the quality of the products and the good service she delivers. She hopes she can improve her sales, that’s why she’s asking for a loan so she can buy more inputs, diverse products and toys for this special Christmas season.

Yuri has a lot of needs in her house, but that’s why she works a lot. She dreams of providing a good professional education for her children. She also expects to fix some damage that her house has.

Help Yuri to improve her business and the life of her family with a loan.

Esther is 33 years old and lives in the municipality Puerto Salgar. She’s the mother of 2 children, a daughter who is 12 and a son who is 10 years of age. Since they were born she has felt happy and proud, and also motivated to work hard to give them the best life she can. For that, she started a restaurant some years ago because she’s an amazing cook.

She wants to take her restaurant to the next level and she’s aware that to succeed she needs to invest in the business, but the inputs are really expensive and she doesn’t have the capital to do so. She hopes she can increase the profits, be more competitive and make the business sustainable. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy inputs like beers and snacks, and also to hire an employee for this Christmas season.

Esther dreams of watching her children become professionals, that’s why she expects that her restaurant will let her pay for an excellent education for them. You can be part of Esther’s story, loan now and support her dreams.

Gladis is 38 years old, and she didn't go to school. She is in a relationship, and her partner makes a living in agriculture. They have 3 children, only 2 of which live with them.

Gladis makes a living selling food; specifically she makes delicious pupusas. She started this business because she needed to earn income to take care of her family's needs and help pay for the education of her children.

Gladis needs a loan to buy supplies for her business such as flour, oil, and drinks. This will enable her to earn a good income to take care of her family's needs. Gladis dreams of marketing her business on a larger scale and helping her children with their studies.

Maria, who studied up to the seventh grade in basic education, is married. Her life's partner works in agriculture and cares for cattle. She has two children living with her but just one is still dependent, while the other is married and also works. Two grandchildren also live with Maria but are not dependent upon her. So, just her two children depend on her.

Maria works selling clothing by catalog and cosmetics. She has done this for over three years. Maria learned from a sister and decided to do this to seek an income that would permit her to help her children. Also, she receives remittances from the USA and her companion also helps her. She has a small store in her house. Maria used to make "pupusas" (popular snacks) to sell in the streets. It's difficult to say how far she traveled doing this in different places because she did so by bus or traveled in a car belonging to a friend when customers called in their orders for products to be delivered.

Maria needs the loan to purchase cosmetics and clothing to improve her sales greatly. She will offer a variety of products to her customers. Also, she wishes to buy at wholesale and improve her earnings, leading to a better quality of life. Maria feels satisfaction because with the loan, she will be able to purchase what her customers are requesting. At the same time, she has felt satisfaction with her previous loans, which have helped improve business. With this new loan, she will have the products in her home to satisfy her customers at the time they need them.

Maria dreams of continuing to advance in business while being able to offer work to people who desire it. Concerning her children, she wants them to propose goals and achieve them. She will help them so that they can aspire to a better personal future. The loan will help Maria and her family achieve their dreams, since the earnings will allow her to buy more products and cover her personal expenses.

Maria will pay off the loan because it is a priority of hers to respond very well to her loans.

Saira is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45000 PKR to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

Nasreen is 52 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Nasreen is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list.

Currently she needs a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

Ma. Isabela is 46 years old, married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Isabela has a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

In the future, Ma. Isabela would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

Pamela is 40 years old married and supporting six children.

She sells dry groceries a business she has done for over fifteen years earning a monthly income of Kshs.15,000.

She has borrowed a loan of Kshs. 50,000 as her third loan after having cleared the previous loans successfully.

With the loan she plans to add maize, beans and millet to her stock of cereals.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to pay school fees for her children as well as repay her loan.

Her future dream is to see her children excel and educate them to higher levels of education.

Kalsoom has successfully built her business of a small general store in her community for many years. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business.

Kalsoom makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make stock available for her customers.

In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Kalsoom wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good quality life to her family members.

Fatuma is a married woman and a mother of three children of whom two are in school. The other one is still young. She’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She owns a food cafe that she has operated for the past six years, selling at home to neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from fellows in the same business, and her aspirations are to open another business in the near future.

Fatuma is borrowing this loan to buy more stock of food for her cafe, including maize and wheat flour. She is grateful for this opportunity, which will help her very much.

She joined Yehu to have access to loans that will help in expanding her business.

Salima is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Salima owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Salima has operated a firewood and fuel selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of working capital which has made her not be able to expand her business.She also sells lessos to increase her income which has been rewarding well and hence her reason to take a loan.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of firewood and more bales of lessos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Lanie is 39 years old and married with three children.  With all three children in school, Lanie works very hard to provide for them.

Lanie has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Lanie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future Lanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

Sandra studied through the sixth grade of basic education. She is married, her partner is pensioned and has two children who live with her in her home but one studies and the other works. No one else lives with her, only two people dependent on her.

Sandra has a store. She has worked on it for more than 18 years. She acquired it by her mother's initiative and decided to do it to seek an income for her family. She also has a corn mill and receives remittances for its use. Before, she only did domestic work. She has the business in her house and travels by car when she goes to the city to buy products for her business. Her husband and children help her. Her schedule is 6:00 am to 6:30 pm from Monday to Sunday.

Sandra will buy products for the store. This will improve her business because she will have more and varied products to offer to her clients and this will create more earnings. She does this to seek a better quality of life. She feels satisfied because with the loan she can continue to work and be even more satisfied because thanks to a loan she could make her store and also has purchased cows. This means that today things are better.

Sandra's dream is to keep working the best she can to be able to have a better future and the loan will help her a lot to achieve her dreams. With the earnings she will keep buying more product and keep paying back the loan because her objective is to respond well to the obligation of the loan so that they keep lending to her.

As a married mother of four children, Herlie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

Herlie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Herlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

Maghdaleen is 43 years old and mother of three. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been running a general store, selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages the household expenses from his store as well, and relatives and neighbors purchase from the store.

He speaks with in a humble manner that is impressive and easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relationship with them. His general store is very famous in the town, which is the reason his business is running well.

Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. That is why Maghdaleen requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, chickpeans, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

Maghdaleen hopes that her son will utilize the loan in positive way. This amount will help him to cope with the needs of her family. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Regina is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the city of Teshi, a place that is well-known because the "ga" ethnic group lives there. The area is known for its beautiful countryside, its ethnic groups, and for being the land bridge that joins the mountain range with the coast. Regina is married and has two children.

She is a very diligent woman whose destiny has been to work hard to support her family. She has the support of her husband, who works in interior and exterior design.

Currently, Rigina makes a living selling clothes. She started the business several years ago, with her mother as her example to follow. She works every day in the afternoon and weekends. She also sometimes goes to fairs in the city.

She will use the loan to buy pants, shirts, and underwear to increase her stock. It is a very good time to invest because of the holiday season, which is when people buy her products.

She thanks Kiva for supporting her as she moves forward. She wishes to establishe a permanent storefront. She is thankful that this business continues to be strengthened so that her family lacks nothing.

She represent the 'Blema tesa' group of four hardworking members.

Shaista is 27 years old, married and a mother of four children. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children.

That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Shaista hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

Parveen, 56 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Parveen needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

Philomenah is 56 years old, married and blessed with five children. She sells ladies shoes, handbags, clothing materials and blankets. She has been in this business for the last 25 years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she plans to purchase shoes, handbags, clothing materials, and blankets to sell to her customers. The anticipated profits shall be used to pay back the loan and save for higher borrowing in the future.

Lilian is a 38-year-old married woman who is blessed with three children aged between 8 and 16.

She has been in the clothes selling business for eight years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 22,000.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya.  She intends to buy more clothes for ladies and children to retail in the village.

With the anticipated profits she will be able to help her husband and pay school fees for their children.

Her dream is to become financially stable.

Marusya is 55 years old and she lives with her husband in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Marusya has two sons and both of them are married and with their families they live in Russian Federation. Marusya works at the canteen of the city’s hospital. Her husband is also employed and he works at a private workshop.

Maruysa asks this loan as her husband has serious health problems. With this loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams Marusya will cover the expenses of her husband’s surgery and then the course of treatment at the hospital. Her greetings and great thanks beforehand for Kiva support.

Dora lives with her husband who is 48 years old and her children who are 10 and 15 years old. Her business consists of selling tamales and pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She sells tamales every day, pupusas on certain days and, in some seasons, she also makes riguas (Salvadoran cakes made from corn). She runs her business from her home. Having her business allows her to help with the household expenses.

She will invest in cooking oil, corn, flour, tomatoes, seasonings, drinks, propane gas and other basic ingredients to prepare tamales, pupusas and riguas. She will stock up her inventory in order to work for a long period of time. This will also allow her to better serve her clients. With the help of this loan, she hopes to increase her sales and earnings to continue meeting her obligations.

Her dreams are to repay her debt, give her children better opportunities for growth, and continue to help her husband with the family expenses.

Mahbuba successfully finished her renovations. She is thankful for your sincere support. She is continuing her beloved career and is happy when her number of customers increases. 

Mahbuba has decided to buy furniture for her house, because her furniture is quite old, from Soviet times. With these plans she is looking for a loan. She trusts in you and your support.

Melina is grateful for the support that PADECOMSM has given her through Kiva loans. Thanks to these loans, she has been able to keep in stock the materials she needs for preparing and selling pupusas and clothing. The quality of her product is better and her customers are more satisfied. Additionally, her family is able to have a more comfortable quality of life.

She needs another loan because this will allow her to maintain the continuity of her business. She will invest it in corn, seasonings, drinks, chocolate, cheese, shredded pork, oil, etc. in order to make and sell pupusas. The remaining money will be used to purchase a new industrial iron in order to improve her productivity and provide better attention to her customers.

Mwanakombo is a married mother of three children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.
	

For five years now, she has operated a lessos selling business, selling door to door to neighbours and friends. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase more stock of lessos for resale.
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

The Dusahidiane group is made up of five women.  One of the group members, Shakina, is not featured on the photo but is replaced by her husband, Elysée.  Mariane is the group's representative.  She lives in Bujumbura.  She is 35 and married to Juvénal, a driver.  Together, they have six children between the ages of 17 and 3.  All their children go to school.  Mariane also takes care of one of her relatives' child, who is also a student.

Mariane has been selling clothes and beauty products for the past 15 years.  This is her fourth loan with Turame.  With this current loan, financed by Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothes for resale.  Her goal is to increase her income.

In the coming years, she would like to have a large clothing store.

Edis lives with her children; Her husband is currently living somewhere else, but nonetheless, he continues to help support the family expenses. 

Edis is able to generate income by raising pigs and chickens, a business she has been running for 4 years. She is already well known in her area as an enterprising, responsible, and honest person. 

To strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan that she plans to use to buy pigs and chickens. With her business well stocked she will be able to offer better products and a good service to her clients. She hopes to increase her clientele and generate more income to support her family. 

Her aspiration is to become an example of self-improvement and honesty for other people, in the same way she hopes her sons will follow her example in order to bring positive things to society.

María is a married woman who lives together with her husband and her three children who are economically dependent on her. María's husband is employed and he helps them economically as well. María works selling food products, clothing and also basic grains. María says that she learned about this business thanks to her mother. She has done it for 7 years and she provides her service from 7:00am until 5:00pm. 

María seeks this loan to invest in the purchase of clothing, disposable plates and utensils, basic grains, French bread, etc. in light of the upcoming Chistmas season which is a good opportunity to obtain more income. María thinks that this will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family, moreover, it will strengthen her business and satisfy the needs of her customers. 

María's dream is to be able to get her family ahead and to strengthen her business as much as she can so she can provide university educations to her children.

María is asking for a new loan so that she can buy clothing for women, men and children. The approaching Christmas season is a good time for her to increase her income. She hopes to attract more customers with a greater selection of stock.
María wants to be able to keep providing a good life for her family. María's personal circumstances are stable, her economic situation has improved considerably thanks to the support provided by the previous loan.

44 year old Maria lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She has worked selling personal use products for the last 10 years. Her business is based in her home and she also sells in the streets in the different communities. With the profits she earns from her sales and the help of her husband, they manage to keep going with their home expenses.
She is asking for a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. in brief and thereby be able to continue her work and earn a higher income.

Trinidad is a young 22 year-old married woman with one son who is two years old. Her business is a neighborhood shop.

She is consistent, friendly and hardworking. She runs her business in the Chasquipampa area, which is known for ruins found there of settlements of the ancient Chasquis, who were Incan messengers. It has a mild, dry climate with a maximum temperature of 17 degrees Celsius.

Trinity has a dark complexion and long black hair and is short in stature. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of mainstream culture and to run her business. She shares her life with her husband who sells food next to the shop.

They live in a rented room constructed of brick and a corrugated iron roof and have potable water, electricity and sewage. Her business is the sale of food items such as bread, milk, sugar, and salt, as well as detergent, soap, deodorant, and other products.

She says "I used to sell toys as a travelling salesperson, then my partner and I decided to open a shop and sell food. We help one another with both businesses." Her business is successful because it has no direct competition in the area. The advantage of her business is that her husband works with her, and the disadvantage is the lack of goods to supply it.

Her dream is to open a branch of a neighborhood store. She wants to buy merchandise to stock the her neighborhood shop. This is the first loan she is applying for with the institution in the year that she has been running both businesses.

It is for these reasons that Trinidad is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to stock her neighborhood shop.

Sonya sends her greetings to Kiva and will be happy if she manages her third Kiva deal. Sonya lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region with her daughter and grandchildren. Sonya has vocational education and the specialty of nursing, but she never worked in her profession.

Being in the trading business 20 years, she earns her family's living and also covers the needs of her grandchildren. At the city’s wholesale market renting a stall, she sells women's clothes of great variety and of different styles. Sonya again needs Kiva support for her business, and she asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to renew her stall’s clothes assortment with new winter season women's clothes.

Bunavsha was born in 1978. She is a hardworking and smart woman. Bunavsha is a married parent of three children. Her husband is a driver. Bunavsha, for more than four years, has been busy with her business. She sells children's clothes in a local market. Bunavsha, little by little with the passing of the time. has improved her business and developed her skills. She periodically renews the assortment of her goods and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy children's clothes for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

Minura is 40 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She has a specialized secondary education. To provide income for her family, Minura has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for about 25 years. Today her farm contains a cow and 30 sheep. She grows peppers and beans for sale on 0.60 hectares of land. To continue developing her business, Minura requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy 20 sheep for fattening up and resale. Minura plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and educating her children.

Nato, who is 51 years old from the village of Sartichala. She lives with her pensioner father. Nato earns a living with working as a waitress at the local restaurant and gets a small income. The family lives under poverty as the income is not enough to cover even basic needs of their family. According to above mentioned situation, Nato lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Nato to get a loan of 2500 GEL and start a trading business. She will take the leasehold place for general store, which has a great location in the capital and will purchase all needed products. Nato will start working as a sales lady and will do her best to make the business work in a profitable way.

After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future. With support of the Start Up program Nato will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle with the financial difficulties.

Carolina, who is 39 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She sells plated jewelry and products for personal use by catalog. She has been working in this business for more than 15 years, and she has many customers. With the earnings that she obtains, she manages to pay some of the expenses of her household.

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of more merchandise wholesale to thus continue with her sales.

Rebeca, 57, lives in her own house with her family. She has been running a store in her home for 15 years. She sells a variety of products such as sweets, sodas, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc. and has many customers because of her low prices.

She is requesting a loan to buy more goods wholesale since this is her only source of income, and this will enable her to earn more profit and improve her quality of life.

Emmalinda is 52 years old, married, and is a resident of Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.

Since Emmalinda wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. Last May 14, 2008 both Emmalinda and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to access a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

Emmalinda has now applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with patience & diligence from her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning another stall in the public market.

Jennifer is managing her eatery business in Calamba. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well in supporting the needs of her family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income.

Recently, Jennifer was loaned an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be very happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

As a married parent of three children, Cresencia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Cresencia is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, fruits and other materials for her food production business.

Cresencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

Mrs Thông is 61 years old and she is married with two children. Thông lives in the Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Thông is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her solidarity group. 

She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. however, her family is one of the low-income households in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that she faces is lack of capital. In 2011, Thông joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thông has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future. With her business profit, Thông hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

Mrs Châu is 57 years old and married. Châu lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
She has worked in agriculture, farming food and raising poultry, for more than 10 years. However, her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Châu faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise, as well as supplies for farming.

This is Châu's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Châu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

Mrs Hường is 59 years old and married. Hường lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
She has operated a food stall selling vegetables in the market for five years. However, her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region. Hường's circumstances are the most difficult in this group. Her husband passed away 10 years ago, when her three children were very young. Her family is living in a small house in the village. Her main income is from her vegetable stall in the market.

The main hardship that Hường faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell. This is Hường's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Hường hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to remodel her house.

As a married mother of four children, Criselda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Criselda is borrowing PHP 55,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell for her fish vending business.

Criselda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

Mrs. Tấn is 59 years old and married with two children. She has had a retail business selling poultry for ten years.

Tấn lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, this job is unstable.

Tấn is a reputable person in the community. Although this is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, all members agreed to vote for her to be the leader of "Dynamic Women" solidarity group.

The main hardship that Tấn faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to resell.

With her business profit, Tấn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain a successful business.

Gayane lives in Ijevan city in Tavush region. She is an accountant and, from 1997 until today, she has worked in her specialty at different organizations. Gayane is married, and her husband and son temporarily live and work in Russian Federation, while Gayane with her daughter lives in Ijevan.

Gayane has serious health problems and with the doctor’s direction she must endergo urgent surgery. This loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams is needed for paying for her surgery at the hospital.

As a married mother of four children, Erma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Erma is borrowing through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

DÚO LOS CHAJONES The duo "Los Chajones"

This duo was formed by Oralia de los Angeles who is 25, married with one child. She advises that for the last four years she has been running a convenience store selling staples (beans, maize, snacks and water) as well as fruit and vegetables. She also has a small bookshop (notebooks, books, glue, paper, pencils etc) With the Christmas season approaching, her customers are coming to her shop more often.She wants to stock up so that her customers buy fruit to make punch and other meals and snacks. This is why she wants Fape Kiva to disburse the loan that she has applied for.

This borrower is a married woman who is 40 years old.  She is worried about her mother's health.  Her mother suffers from a chronic illness, and also had a heart attack some time ago which has had consequences for her vision.  She has problems with the retina in her left eye, and she also suffers from cataracts.  

Due to these problems, she urgently needs an operation to recover her sight.  However, she lacks the resources needed to pay for the costs of the surgery.

Nargis is a 61-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their client children.

Recently, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers and generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

Blanca, 39 years old, is a single mother and lives with her 3 children in one of the communities of the municipality of Yoro. she has worked for 15 years selling basic grains such as beans, corn, and pork. She raises and fattens pigs to sell the meat. She has been very enterprising and has invested various loans in the business to keep it alive. Currently, she asks for another as part of a group loan to purchase corn and beans to resell, in addition to selling pork, with this she will take advantage of the end of the year season to increase her sales. Her goal is to improve her house, offer her children a better education, and strengthen her business. The group called Mujeres Bendesidas is made up of 4 members who work selling basic grains. They all live in the same community and are identified as follows: on the left with a red jacket is Dina, then Blanca, followed by Caren and on the right side is Marta.

Mrs. Tinh, 28, is a Lao ethnic woman who is married and is the mother of a boy and a girl who are 9 and 6 years old. They live together happily in a stilt house in a small remote village where agriculture is the main income-generating activity.

Like other villagers, Mrs. Tinh and her husband work very hard at farming and animal husbandry with plenty of activities, such as growing rice, corn, and cassava, and breeding pigs, buffalo, chickens, and fish. Her husband sometimes works for a construction employer to earn extra income and support the family better.

Mrs. Tinh has always wanted to develop production in a sustainable way, so she has taken out loans in the Anh Chi Em Program to have enough capital to expand agricultural production. She also frequently receives training and counseling from the agricultural workers of the Program, so she is well aware of the necessity of having a pigsty when raising pigs.

For that reason, recently she has taken out a loan from Anh Chi Em to build a pigsty. She hopes that with the pigsty, the pigs will grow fast and healthy and then help her reap good profits and gradually improve income as well as living standards for her family.

Mrs. Tinh hopes that her children will study well, enter good colleges, have good jobs, and then escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands as the first from the right.

The featured borrower is Djènèba, standing in the front with her hand on a bag full of groundnuts in the group photo. She is a 33-year-old reseller of groundnuts from Mali, married with 5 children ages 2 to 17; she has two daughters in school. She buys her stock at the local market each week, then sells the shelled groundnuts at nearby markets; she earns a profit of 10,000FCFA per month.

While Djènèba is doing well, she wants to expand her activity. To that end, she is seeking a loan with RMCR to bolster her working capital and increase her profits. This will help her to support her family.

She joined RMCR five years ago and her credibility has not failed. Her goal is to have a shop to store more merchandise.

Yunila is 32 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are now of school age. Yunila earns a living from the sales in her little general (sari-sari) store. She's been in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month. Yunila has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years.

Yunila is requesting a loan to purchase four sacks of feed and additional groceries to sell.  In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari business.

Aurora works hard to support herself. She is single and has a home product retail business in the Philippines.

Aurora requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more home products to offer for sale.

She has been in this business for eleven years.

In the future, Aurora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Maceline is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she makes and sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of tailoring materials. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  She will save the anticipated profits.

DUO DANY DE SANTO TOMAS

This duo was formed by Doña Julia Imelda. She is 27 years old and sells products for daily use such as sugar, grains, candies, soda water, rice, pasta, detergent, milk, refried beans, and stuffed chiles in her store, which has been located in her home for several years.

She is applying for the loan for the purchase of merchandise for the Christmas season, as well as groceries in general to stock her store and have all the necessary products for her customers in this season.

Paula continues with her grilled meats business. She used the previous loan to buy a new grill to replace the old one. Her loan payments were made on time because the business went as expected. Now it has improved with the new grill and she can cook more meat and stay open longer. Her new customers are requesting cold drinks to go with the food but she has no refrigerator for the drinks, "My partner and I continue to work hard and through much effort the business is getting ahead..." she says.

Her business is successful because she has no local competition. The advantage is that she works with her partner and the disadvantage is the lack of a refrigerator for the drinks.

Her dream is to have a consolidated, well-known restaurant. She wants to buy a refrigerator for sodas and a counter. This is her second loan through the institution in the year she has been in business.

Paula is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and soda counter to improve her business.

Mirian is 25 years old, lives with her husband and they have two dependent children. For several years she has earned a living through her grocery selling business. She is a hard working woman with a desire to succeed.

Mirian is applying for a loan to buy grocery store products such as rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, cheese, milk and bread. She also wants to buy sandals and shoes in order to start this new business and take advantage of the Christmas season.

Mirian with the support of this loan wants to supplement her financing needs and improve her quality of life as it comes up to Christmas. She wants to buy stock to sell more and better serve her customers. Her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2015.

Ely is 34 and finished high school but couldn't continue her studies because of a lack of support from her parents and the distance. She lives with her partner who works in construction and is the mother of two children.

Ely has had a store for three years which she opened thanks to the motivation she received from her mother and father. But besides that she also works three days a week in another store where she has been supported in her efforts to get ahead. While she works her husband helps with sales in her store when he has time.

Ely needs this loan to buy more staples such as sugar, rice, beans, corn, oil, milk, coffee, salt, eggs and other products in order to generate more income which will allow her to continue growing her business little by little.

Ely hopes to increase her inventory and make her store profitable and have many customers in her community.

Abigail sells clothes and she is the mother of 2 daughters. Abigail is living in her parents house and she helps them with the expenses and the chores.

She needs a loan to buy merchandise for her business, since Christmas is coming. She will take advantage of that to increase her sales and to make more money. She hopes you can help her, because she buys good clothes, so she deserves a chance

Jane is a married mother of five children, who all attend school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a business selling handbags from her home to friends and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business by opening a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase more handbags for resale.
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Nusrat is 34 years old. She is the mother of three children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a crockery shop for many years near his house and the business is operating very well.

According to the customer’s demand he wants to keep crockery stock in demand for several occasions. He does not want to refuse any products and disappoint any of his respected customers. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy the required crockery for his shop.

She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that her husband will successfully fulfill requests for any item and satisfy his customers.

Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

A 48-year-old married mother of one child, Layla has been working from her house selling accessories and beauty cosmetics since 2007, with 14 years of experience in her domain. She is a hardworking lady who is putting so much effort into supporting her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.

Today, because Layla's income combined with her husband's is barely enough to cover their family's living expenses, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to purchase newly released accessories and cosmetics especially for the coming Christmas season. Layla is planning to open a retail shop in the future, and hopes that this development will be soon.

Claris is 38 years old and supports six people in her family.

She sells clothes and hand bags, a business she has been doing for the past eight years. She earns a monthly income of 3,000 KES.

Claris has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more hand bags for selling. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into her business.

Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to friends and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation to various markets. She dreams of expanding her business in the future
. 
With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase more bales of clothes for resale.
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Robina is a 30-year-old housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, and is mother to a child. Her husband, the only wage-earning person in the family, is a taxi driver.

He needs capital for the maintenance of his taxi. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to pay for the maintenance. Therefore his wife Robina, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband.

With the profits, they will be able to have some savings. Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Parveen is the age of 54; she is mother of three. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many weeks his rickshaw has not worked properly, thus he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the repairing cost of his rickshaw. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen is so much thankful to Kiva and it's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Ana applies for a new loan based on the need to reactivate her business. She is planning to buy an assortment of bread to resell. Another portion will allow her to acquire clothing articles, with new styles, to satisfy the taste of her customers. She hopes to manage her loan very well in order to get positive results.

The previous loan has helped her to offer her customers greater variety, which has slightly improved her sales and income. Currently, given she has diversified more her business, she has stopped making bread in the large quantities she was previously producing, and now she relies on suppliers. She has her family, keeps the same group, but nowadays they can share a more deserving lifestyle.

Rosa is 56 years old and is a married woman who lives with her husband in the municipality of Sincelejo. Last year, she decided to start her own business because her family is going through some economic issues that she wants to solve. Now she manages a fruit and vegetable store, something she learned thanks to some training she took before.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some packages of “ñame" and "yuca” (traditional Colombian tubers), corn and some chili pepper. She hopes that this loan will let her increase her sales and clients so the business can proper. She dreams of paying for her children's education, something that is really important for their future.

Help Rosa to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan.

Alexandra is 33 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellín. She has a little daughter who is only four years of age and whom she loves more than anything. Her daughter was the reason for her to start her own business three years ago, a food place where she prepares and sells delicious food.
