She’s asking for a loan so that she can buy products like rice, oil, grain, disposables, and an umbrella to improve her food place. She hopes that with these improvements and investment she can improve her sales by increasing her clientele, and that this will enable her to accomplish some dreams like paying for her daughter's education and buying a house where they can live a great life.

Alexandra needs a little support, and you can help her with the loan she needs.

Nsene is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Nsene has operated a coconut business for over four years now, selling at the market to buyers at Mombasa market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her aspirations are to open a green grocer in future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more coconut supplies for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Nasreen is the age of 38, living in Rawalpindi, with her family. Her son has been running a barber shop for three years, he has been using salon instrument for many years. Worn out instrument need to be replaced with new one. He wants to buy new instruments but his financial constraints are becomes a hindrance to buy them.

Due to his low purchasing power, Nasreen requested a loan so that her son can become empowered and he can easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror and revolving chair.
Nasreen hopes that this loan will work positively and she would be able to make some saving for household expenses.Nasreen thanks to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Ercilla, 40, has a high school education. She has a partner and her dependent daughter attends high school.

Erciila runs a business delivering food such as typical breakfasts and lunches. Her partner and daughter help her in the business. They sell mainly to businesses and workshops in the areas near where they live.

Ercilla is in need of a loan to buy a motorcycle since demand is greater and she is unable to fill the orders. With the motorcycle she will be able to meet demand and deliver the orders on time.

Ercilla dreams of having a formal diner and establishing a strategic location in the community, as well as hiring employees to continue her delivery business and have a large locale.

Keiry earns a living selling clothing (new and used) and sandals. She also works as a sales agent for a community organization. When she is at work her mother helps with her business. In her free time, Keiry dedicates herself completely to her business and when necessry she goes out as a street vendor to earn extra income. She learned her trade from her mother and has verifiable experience. Keiry lives with her partner and family.

She will buy new clothing, sandals and other personal care products in order to have enough stock to meet customer demand. This will generate more income to pay off debt. She hopes to take advantage of the year-end holiday season to sell more.

Keiry's dream is to build her own house, expand her business by opening a store and stabilize her economy to reduce household necessities.

Sonia needs a loan to buy cleaning products. She has a little store where she sells these products. She is married and she is the mother of four kids. She also has a passion for music. She sings with a tropical band.  She hopes you can help her because she works hard. She is healthy.

Helder is 51 years old and a single mother. She lives in her home with parents and her son in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, and department of Lambayeque, in Perú. 

She has very good references, both personal and work-related, through the people of the area. The residents of this locality mostly work in agriculture, business, and by raising livestock.

Helder works by selling her beers and carbonated drinks. She has more than 3 years' experience in this line of business. 

She is seeking a loan in order to invest in her business so that she can buy more boxes of beer and packages of carbonated drinks, and thus be able to make some improvements to her store. 

Helder is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

Verónica, 38, is married and lives in a house with her partner and their children in the district of Cayalti, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque province in Peru. She has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The residents of this town are dedicated to agriculture, trade and livestock for the most part.

She is dedicated to selling clothing, with more than ten years experience in this role. Additionally, she is dedicated to raising and selling animals. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and to buy a shop.

Verónica is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a married woman and a homemaker. She also works in catalog sales from her home to support her husband who works as a laborer in a factory.

She suffers from intense pain in her inferior molars as she has a bad infection due to not treating it on time. This was due to a lack of financial resources. She needs a regenerative treatment to avoid losing her teeth.

Rosa, 53, lives in her own house with her life partner and her two children. She sells clothing and perfumes and has been in business for five years. Because of her many steady customers she is able to keep the business afloat. The earnings from sales are used to cover some of the household expenses.

The customer is requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise wholesale and continue her sales to generate a good profit.

Reyna, age 43, is married and has two minor children. She is from Managua. She is known for being hard-working and responsible with the desire for personal improvement. She struggles every day in order to get ahead with her family and to provide her children with a better future. Unfortunately, she was not able to go to school due to the lack of financial resources. However, she would have liked to have studied to be a nurse.

Her current goals and objectives are to provide a better future for her children and to give them better living conditions. Thanks to her desire to get ahead, she has a business activity, a beauty salon. It is located at her house. She works ten hours a day providing her services.

The objective of the loan is to invest in beauty products like dyes, blush , acrylic nails, straighteners, eye shadow, and nail polish, etc.

Rosario is still in business selling potatoes. She used her previous loan to buy her product wholesale. She made all of her payments on time because she made very good sales. Her business improved because she was able to offer better prices and that attracted more customers. "Sales are good and I hope things will stay that way," she says.

Her business is successful because her prices are affordable. Her main advantage is that she now has new customers, which brings about the disadvantage of not having enough product to meet their needs. For this reason, Rosario is requesting a new loan to buy wholesale potatoes and vegetables and meet the season's high demand.

Her goal is to further improve sales by the end of the year. This is her second loan through Kiva, and she has been in this business for thirty years.

Profile of the Soroyiriwaton Group (1397)

Salimata is pictured with her hands on the sack of rice. She is from Mali and never went to school. She is 38 years old, married, a housewife, and the mother of three children between the ages of 12 and 20. Two of her children go to school. Her husband is a farmer.

Salimata has been storing rice for 10 years. She buys her supplies at the rural market and sells her goods in neighboring markets. The profits that she earns will allow her to help her husband meet their family's needs.

Salimata borrows money from RMCR so that she can buy more rice and grow her revenues. She feels good about working in this domain as it's rather profitable. Salimata is debt-free and has been working with RMCR for 9 years.

Having dealt with frequent slumps in sales, her dream is to build a permanent home for her family with the profits from her business.

Bahtiniso is a capable woman. She is married and has three children. She has been busy with a farming business during some years. She grows a variety of vegetables on land that is rented.

Bahtiniso is looking for a loan to enlarge her business. She is going to use the loan for the land's rent, and to buy fertilizers and seeds.

She believes that by increasing her farming business, she will increase her income. This loan will help her achieve her goals and improve her family's quality of life. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 TJS with this aim. She awaits your help and mercy.

Yaneth, 22, is a member of the Grupo Solidario Superacion Group. She is a single mother with two children, ages 6 and 4, one of whom attends school. She runs a variety store and is requesting a loan to buy Christmas products. Her customers are neighbors, friends and people in her community.

She started out selling juices but was able to earn more profit selling various products. Her goals are to improve her quality of life, increase production and income, strengthen the business, and pay for her children's education.

She has had four loans through FAPE which have helped her to grow her business.

Ana is 43 years old and married. Her husband is a driver who is usually on the road away from home. They have four children who attend state funded school in the area: Alberto, 23, Dario, 19, Wilmer, 17 and Katherine, who is 12. Ana is very cheerful, and has worked for more than twenty years selling cosmetics and clothing, and she also paints figures and makes crafts. She is very creative in the way she tries to support her children so that they do not lack for anything.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock her business which she runs in the afternoons. She will buy materials for her crafts which she makes at night, and the money she generates from the profit could continue to cover the costs of food and education for her children. Her biggest dream is to own her own home.

Rano is a friendly young woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband helps her with managing the business.

All the money that she earns goes to provide her family with all necessary things, and she is not in a position to save any money for another long-term goal. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her corn plants because she wants to develop her agriculture activity. Part of the loan will also go toward paying for labor. This will allow her to make sure all the work is done well.

She wants additional income, and that’s why she needs to improve her business. She is asking for a loan of TJS 10,000 with this aim. This loan will help her achieve her goals and improve her family's quality of life.

Layla is a 35-year-old married woman. She used to work as a secretary for a company, but then thought of starting her own business to earn a better income to help her husband in supporting her three kids.

Layla used the money she saved from her work and opened a beauty salon. Using her connections she was able to furnish the salon with the basic equipment at a good price.

Now that her business is doing well, she is requesting a loan in order to replace the old tools with new ones. She also plans to add a section for manicures to better serve the ladies at her salon.

Julia is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has had a store located in her place of residence for more than three years. She has many clients especially her neighbors as she has a variety of products. With the earnings she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, pastries, etc to be able to have greater income for a better quality of living.

Shazia is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband operates a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, and sells to relatives as well. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. 

Due to good relations, Shazia's husband's sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Shazia requested a loan for her husband from BRAC Pakistan, which he will use to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Shazia hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way and that this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family.

Mrs. Hương is 52 years old and she is married with two children. Hương lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the Hương's Group, which consists of three members.

Hương has had a retail business selling milk, sugar, salt, cake, and general items for more than 10 years. Her family lives in a low-income household in her village where the market need is low.

The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase more milk, sugar, salt, cake, and general items to resell.

In 2012, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain a successful business.

Yoneila is a microentrepreneur. She's 56 years old and lives with her family in a neighborhood in the south of Barranquilla. She sells garments and accessories, a business she started 15 years ago. Her main customers are her friends, neighbors and referrals. She makes sales directly at her customers' homes every day of the week. She sells a diverse assortment of women's, men's and children's apparel. December is the season with the highest demand of the year and, as a way to meet her customers' orders, she requested a Kiva loan. It's an opportunity for her to have a link to the financial community of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that she can purchase new collections of clothing: blouses, dresses, jeans, bermudas and etc. Her goal for the future is to own a grocery store and finish remodeling her house.

Shazia is 41 and she is married. She lives with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Shazia purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this for many years, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to winter season, the demand for warm clothing has increased as well.

This is the reason Shazia showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of warm clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

Tâm is 56 years old and married with two children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Tâm lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.Her family is a low-income household in village and the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Tâm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to raise and sell in the future.

This is Tâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the Poor but Fun Group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

Mrs Hồi is 54 years old and she is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Hồi lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover, this job is unstable. The main hardship that Hồi faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Hồi's group, which consists of three members. With her business profits, Hồi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

Mrs Phơ is 54 years old and she is married with 2 children.

She has worked in agriculture raising cow for more than 10 years.
Phơ lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Phơ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cow to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Phơ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Phơ has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the "Best repayment" group, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Phơ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to find a good job.

Mrs Hương is 22 years old and married with four children. She has had her retail business selling fish for three years, and is planning to hire more workers in the future.  

Hương lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her income is lower than the national average, and moreover, this region often suffers natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. Hương has no collateral because she can't get a loan from banks or credit institutions. The main hardship she faces is lack of capital.

In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution in order to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution so far. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Hương is a reputable person in her community, and the leader of her solidarity group. With her profits, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

Hồng is 27 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by local government as poor, and moreover her region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. She has no collateral because she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

Hồng has had a retail business selling dry food for 6 years. She is a reputable person in the community and is the leader of her solidarity group. The main hardship that she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

In 2011, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has already successfully repaid 4 loans from them.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She is planning to hire more workers in the future.

Maxyne is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children.

She has had a retail shop business for 3 years. She will be using the loan to purchase to buy stock of retail goods e.g. cooking fat, flour and soft drinks to sell to his customers and hopes this will help her to support her husband in paying school fees for their children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children well through university.

She is in her second loan cycle and has borrowed KShs 35,000 to be repaid in 12 months

Ana Blanca is 24 years old. She is a single mother and has humble origins. She has a three-year-old daughter, whom she gave birth to when she was 21 years old. Unfortunately, the father did not understand his daughter's worth and told Ana to raise the child on her own. This situation encouraged Ana to leave the father, who was preventing her from achieving her dreams and aspirations.

Ana herself was abandoned by her father and raised through a lot of hard work by her mother. Ana finished her education at Achocalla school and went on to study cookery and event management. This knowledge led to Ana opening a business, called "Venta de Platos a la Leña". Ana has premises left to her by her father before his death. She also has ovens, cookers and other tools.

Ana says that she needs a loan in order to organise her premises better to sell dishes such as "pollo a la leña", and "llama a la leña" (chicken and llama dishes). The income that will result from this loan will help Ana to improve her quality of life and prove that she can move forward without the help of her husband.

Mrs Tình is 56 years old and is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for five years. Tình lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

In 2011, Tình joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Tình is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her solidarity group. Tình has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

The main hardship that Tình faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. With her business profit, Tình hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to buy land of her own.

Yesenia is a hard-working woman who has worked for 1 year taking care of a beachfront property. She is happy for this work as it allows her to support her family. She is 32 years old and lives with her spouse and her 13-year-old son. Yesenia would like to build a room in her house, and so is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build the room.

Tahira is 43 years old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of the cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Tahira has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

Rasha is the proud owner of a shop that has been selling all types of home products for twenty years. The shop was initially established by her father in law, but Rasha has successfully run the business for four years.

She is Lebanese, 24 years old, and lives in Beirut with her husband who works in water distribution.
She holds a university degree which helps her manage the shop with the needed skills and knowledge.

In order to develop her business, Rasha is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. She needs to buy new products for her shop before the holidays and the Christmas season.

Rasha is well known in the area and her clients see her as an honest, hard working woman who has a very good reputation.

Nellious is a 22-year-old woman with 1 child.

She has had a shoe business for 3 years. She will use the loan to purchase shoes to expand her business and provide for her child.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a plot of land.

She is in her second loan cycle and has borrowed 40,000 KSH to be repaid in 12 months.

Peris is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

With her previous loan, she was able to improve her business and her family's living standard as compared to before.

Peris is grateful for the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders to access loans.

Jackline is a 26-year-old single woman blessed with three children. She has operated a profitable retail shop for three years. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she will buy cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar and detergent to sell. She hopes to make more income and educate her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business, make more income, and be successful.

Miriam is a young woman, 22 years of age, who is very charismatic. She has had to learn to value herself on her own. Her parents migrated outside the country to improve her quality of life. This situation led her to start a business selling in the streets clothing, cosmetics, and articles for the home. Thus, she began to generate income to contribute to her own development. Miriam confesses that it has not been easy but her urge to convert herself into a larger merchant has helped her to not accept defeat.

This season offers growth opportunities for Miriam's business. For that reason, she is applying to Kiva and MiCredito for a loan that will permit her to purchase makeup, clothing for men and women, sandals for girls, and articles for the home, among other products that her customers look for at the time of Christmas celebrations. In the future, Miriam hopes to be able to open a store in her neighborhood, preferably located in some market center in her city.

Angela is 25 years old and lives with her life partner and her 10-year-old son. She has painstakingly managed to advance herself. She is a very admirable woman, who has worked providing housekeeping services for the past 5 years. Angela wishes to construct a hallway in her home and is applying for a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, stones, gravel, bricks, and iron to build the hallway.

Ana, who is 44 years old, lives with her life partner and her two children, who are 11 and 14 years old and are in school. She works selling beauty products by catalog, an activity that she has done for the past 5 years and through which she works with many clients. She wishes to continue improving her home, as she previously obtained a loan with which she improved the fence around her house. She is now applying for a new loan through FUSAI to buy cement, stones, gravel, bricks, and iron to construct a room in her home.

Norbibi very kind and bright woman. Norbibi lives in a city of Tajikistan with her family. She is careful woman of her four children. Her children are adult. She tries to offer the best condition of life.

Norbibi 25 year ago has begun her business for buying and selling shoes because she needed the money. Norbibi buys shoes in a bulk and retails in a local market in low price. That’s why she finds status among other business women. Norbibi time by time renews the assortment of her goods. Norbibi now is going to buy new winter shoes for this winter season. She is asking for 7000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your support.

Fatuma is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her biggest monthly expense is rent.

For the past three years she has operated a cosmetic selling shop business, selling at retail at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of opening a salon business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase a stock of cosmetics, including hair chemicals, sprays, lotions, braids and creams to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mariana studied to be a chef. She is a 30-year-old entrepreneur with a 4-year-old daughter who depends on her. Over a year ago, Mariana completed training in the preparation of pastas and desserts. Now that she knows this line of work a bit better, she wants to invest in starting up an Italian pasta business, giving it a business focus since she prepared her products in the artisanal way and orders have been placed.

Mariana has good prospects since what most motivates her is to succeed. With various goals to achieve, she wants to get to form a working capital that will give her better economic stability.

Mariana sees that her pasta business can grow and expand to new markets in other localities in the region, and so, have a business focus and achieve the objectives that she herself has outlined throughout her career.

Jane, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has three schooling children.

She has been running a food-vending business famously known as a "mama lishe" for six years. She works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restore the out-of-stock items in her mama lishe food store.

She dreams of expanding her business into a restaurant.

Jane will share this loan with her loan group, Nyota Kinyamwezi, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Mrs Anh is 47 years old and she is married with three children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Anh lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Anh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in the future.

In 2010, Anh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the "Funny Farm" group, which consists of four members. With her business profits, Anh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

Mrs. Minh is 62 years old and she is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture, raising pigs for eight years. Minh lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. In addition, the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Minh faces is a lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of Minh's Group, which consists of five members. With her business profit, Minh hopes to build a new house, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

Silpa, aged 29, studied up to eighth grade, is married and has two children with her husband, who are both in school.

Silpa has owned a small shop for five months. She also has a pig farm, and her husband also helps her with agricultural work. She decided to set up a shop in the area where she lives as there is not much competition and a fairly large population.

Silpa needs this loan to buy rice, beans, coffee, sugar, bread and detergent, among other products, to improve her shop's inventory.

Silpa dreams of having a well-established business and providing for her children's needs.

Juana, is 38 years old. She went to school up to the ninth grade. She lives with her 23 year old daughter and her nine year old son who is in elementary school.

Juana sells personal use products such as lotions, deodorants, shampoos, and more. She also sells silver and gold plated jewelry, and that is why she knows her own activity so well. She also grows basic grains.

Juana needs the loan to buy lotions, shampoos, and other personal use products.

Juana dreams of her family having better living conditions and for her children to get and education and have good careers.

Mrs Thùy is 30 years old and she is married with 4 children.

She has operated a food stallt selling fish for 6 years.
Thùy lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Thùy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

In 2012, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thùy has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the "Mama's love" group, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Thùy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school and for her business to do well.
The child's mother in the photo is a member in this group, she agree to post her child's photo in Kiva's website.

Mrs Liên is 61 years old and she is married with 4 children. Liên lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has worked in agriculture raising cattle for more than 10 years.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable .

Liên is a reputable person in the community. Although this is her first loan in Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members agreed to vote her to be the leader of solidarity group.
The main hardship that Liên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

Maria, 49, lives in her own house with her family. For two years, she has had a small store located at her place of residence. She sells a variety of products such as: soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, soap, detergents, sugar, etc. With the sales she makes, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale in order to continue making sales to generate a higher income.

Khadijeh is a married woman and has three children. She is household supplies and novelties household.‎
Her husband is working as a tailor and his income is not enough for cover all the needs.‎
‎ Khadijeh wants to help her husband in the household expenses and she is working hard to provide good education for her ‎kids, therefore she is thinking to expand her business and increase her incomes.‎
She decided to apply for loan and boost her business. She wants to purchase more antiques and new household supplies ‎to sell and improve her standards of living. She is very grateful to Kiva for the support.‎

Mrs Tám is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has worked in agriculture raising cattle for 6 years.Tám lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family's household is low-income. Moreover, the market demand is low in this region.

Tám is a reputable person in her community. Although this is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, all members of her group voted her as the leader of the solidarity group.

The main hardship that Tám faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, Tám hopes for her business to do well, for her children to excel in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

Zeynegul successfully repaid her loan, after using for its intended purpose.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who have helped her to obtain this previous financing.  She currently has eight cows, 42 sheep, and one horse on her farm.  She also grows potatoes, alfalfa, and barley for resale on 1.6 hectares of her own land and 0.5 hectares of leased land.  She makes a monthly income of 22,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further grow her farming business, she has once more contacted Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and she is taking a loan of 150,000 (KGS) som to buy a few additional cows.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business and to educate her children.

Nurbubu is a 48-year-old widow and the mother of four children.  For the past 20 years, she has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three cows, 31 sheep and two horses on her farm.  She also grows barley and alfalfa on 1.2 hectares of leased land and 1.65 hectares of her own land.  She makes up to 35,000 som (KGS) every month from her combined activities.  Having realized that her farming business could be profitable, she has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy six steers for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business and to improve her family's material well-being.

Francisca has a sixth grade education. She is married to a carpenter and has three children; two attend school and her daughter works to help her parents.

Francisca has been running a store in her home for two years. She decided to set it up in order to help her husband with the household expenses, as before she only attended to the family. Her children and husband help with the store and household chores in their free time.

Francisca is in need of a loan to buy soap, detergent, oil, rice and other products she needs for the business. This will allow her to add more stock and be able to offer a wider variety of products.

Francisca dreams of expanding her store to help her family enjoy a better quality of life and insure that her children can complete their education.

Nawab is a 34-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Nawab makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She will use this to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available to her customers. In this way, she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Nawab wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing a good-quality life to her family members.

Evelyn is 53 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish and egg to sell to customers.

Evelyn has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

Grace is a 52-year-old married woman blessed with five children between the ages of 15 and 26.

She has been a butcher for eight years and earns a monthly income of 35,000 KSH. She has had 5 loans with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy cattle, goats and sheep.

She will use her profits to buy food, increase her share, and re pay the loan. Her dream is to expand the business and live happily.

This is Eunice. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more supplies for her business. She says her family's living standard has also improved since the last loan. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. She works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for KES 50,000 to buy more stock of flour, oil, beans, etc. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mwanakombo is married with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She has operated a food stall business for the past three years, selling at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of storage means in her business. She also sells firewood.  Her dream is to buy a fridge to be able to preserve her food in the near future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mwanajuma is a married woman and a mother of four children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her goals are to fix an underground water source.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She also sells water. Mwanajuma is requesting a loan to buy grocery and water for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Isavary is 26 years old. She is married with one child. She does farming and also has a retail business which she has been running for three years. She will be using the loan to buy cereals such as maize, beans, wheat, and millet to sell and hopes this will enable her to make more profits to provide food for her family and build a bigger cereal shop.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

Jay Liza is a sari-sari (varieties) store owner. Sari-sari store is a small retail outlets that can be found in almost all neighborhoods, sometimes even on every street corner, in the Philippines. It is privately owned shop operated inside the store owner’s shop. Jay Liza is a 38-year-old woman has been operated this business for 8 years in the town of Carles, Iloilo. She has been doing this to support her family.

With this, she is asking for a loan to buy more commodities to sell, like drinks, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, candies, chips, biscuits, salt, and sugar. In this way, her store looks full and it will attract more buyers. Jay Liza’s ultimate goal is to expand her business for their sustainability.

Flordeliza is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has eight children. Her oldest child is 21 years old, while her youngest child is seven years old. Her husband raised them through their farm; thus, her husband is a farmer while Flordeliza sells imported used clothes known as “ukay-ukay”. She has been doing this for three years to earn and helps her husband in providing the needs of her children.

With this, she is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy imported used clothes to sell. Other part of her loan amount is to buy feed for her pigs and buy “tongog” (a tannin powder used by tuba gatherer to add color to the coconut wine). Definitely, Flordeliza is engaged in hog raising business while her husband gathers coconut wine known as “tuba”. In this way, she will be able to enhance her livelihood and augment her profit.

Honey Lee is always traveling to sell her various consumable products, which gives her an approximate income of PHP 10,000 per month. She needs to help her parents provide for the needs of their family, knowing her youngest sibling is already in college.

Honey Lee is 24 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC.

Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional capital so that she can supply the demands of her growing number of customers. The amount will be used to purchase additional stocks for her buy-and-sell business.

Jane is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. She is a single woman, running a sari-sari (variety) store business to support her family. She has been doing this for four years. Aside from this, she also engaged in buying and selling dried fish to the community. With this, Jane is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs and drinks. Other part of her loan is to buy dried fish to sell. In this way, Jane was able to enhance her earnings for her family.

Mildred is married and is the mother of two children. She lives in Nakuru, Kenya. Mildred works together with her husband in the local market where they sell carrots, cabbages, sweet potatoes, paw paw and pumpkins. They have been in this business for over five years, and she dreams of expanding it. With her Kiva loan, Mildred will be able to purchase stock and to increase both her retail and wholesale supplies to satisfy her customers' demand.

Inspired stories like Martha's are what make people feel motivated to start their own businesses. The workday runs from 5:00 am until 5:00 pm for this 51-year-old entrepreneur who has the goal of supporting her family and with the help of her daughters and her husband. Previously she had requested a loan to buy corn, flour, chairs and tables for her business. This allowed her to have an excellent income such that she gives a heartfelt thanks to all of the people that helped her with this loan.

At this time, Martha dreams of continuing to reach her goals, among them is starting a small store. For now she is requesting a new loan to buy flour, bags, corn, gas, chairs and tables; the last two items will be leased out. The loan will allow her to save on the purchase, and obtain better profits as well as leasing the fixed assets. They will help her to have another form of income for her home. In the future, she also dreams about improving her house and continuing to improve her quality of life.

Susan is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance. She is a married woman with children.

She is a business woman who operates a retail shop in the city outskirts, selling home product items, especially sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, beverages, bread and sugar, among other items.

In abid to increase her working capital /expand the business, she has applied for a loan of 1,500,000. She will use the loan to buy stock of plastics, kitchen ware, toiletries, beverages and groceries for sell. She is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital.

Susan and the group members are very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to them since they are now able to fund their businesses.

Mrs Hằng is 45 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has operated a food stall selling fish for 8 years. Hằng lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Hằng faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the 09 Hưng bắc, Hưng Lộc, which consists of 4 members.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job and for her business to do well.

Ma. Sisa is a resident in the town of Tolosa. She earns a living running a sari-sari(variety) store and sells merchandise such as noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods.
Aside from that she also runs a bakery. She sold bread and pastries, as means of supplemental income to its household. She is married woman and has three young children. She would like to filled her store with variety of supplies to cater its demands. She decided to join CEVI to avail loan.

Ma. Sisa has requested a loan to purchase soft drinks and frozen goods. In that way, she will be able to serve her respective clients well. Thus, enabling her daily income to improve.

In the future, Ma.Sisa is aiming to have a healthy family and a sustainable livelihood.

Kaneez , 61 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Kaneez  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 60000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

Mohana is a 41-year-old married mother of two. Five years ago, she started working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She has a good reputation in her region and has her loyal customers.

She is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate her business and allow her to move to her customers' houses easily.

Mohana hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

Naisula is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells soft drinks, bread, airtime and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes. 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soft drinks, airtime and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.  She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

With great determination, Pabla decided one day to become independent from her employer and start her own business, so she could receive more income for the service provided. Her previous employer did not pay well.

Pabla is married and together with her husband, they have built a great household. She contributes financially through her chicken and food business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase chickens to raise, ingredients to prepare food, and cooking utensils.

Pabla hopes that this will help her business to continue to grow at the same pace as it has been, so she can continue generating income that will support her household financially.

Maria, without being able to depend on much capital but maintaining the desire to move forwards that people have always noticed about her, finds herself obligated to look for a source of income that will allow her to support her household economically.  

Thanks to a friend who taught her how to run a business, Maria decided to start a business selling clothing and personal-use products from her home, where she has a window to display her goods.   Thanks to the business, she has been able to bring in extra income that allows her to have a better quality of life.  

Because of her excellent customer service and the good quality of her products, Maria has captured the attention of a great number of customers that guarantee her good sales in her business, to such an extent that her lack of capital has become a constant obstacle in her efforts to respond to the large orders that her customers place with her.  

With the intention of buying merchandise for her business, she is seeking a loan to provide her with the possibility of gaining access to more wholesale clothing and personal-use products that she will use to fill her customers' orders. 

Maria hopes that this purchase of merchandise will allow her to continue responding to the demands that her customers make and be able to continue increasing her capital so that her business continues to grow more and more each time.

Julie is 25 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Salgar. She has always dreamed of being a successful woman, and she works hard to accomplish that goal. Two years ago she started her own business: she sells different products, like clothes and accessories. The business is something that she started to meet her economic needs.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy merchandise like jeans, blouses, perfume, and women's bags for resale this Christmas season. She expects that this investment will help her to be more competitive in the market and will help her business to continue in the future. 

She wants to improve the conditions of her house.

You can help Julie to accomplish all her dreams with a loan.

Sandra is 45 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pedro de Uraba. She has two children, a son and a daughter, and started a sales business five years ago to help her boyfriend and father of her children to provide for their family. She started this business with the help of her mother in law. Sandra has a lot of dreams regarding her business, including opening a store, creating new jobs and having a big selection of items for customers to buy. She’s aware of the need to invest in the business so it can get better, and wants to increase her clients and profits, which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy clothes, shoes, bed sheets and other items to sell during this Christmas season.  Her goal for the future is to save enough money for her children to have a good education so they can succeed.

Elba is 49 years old and married, her husband works in agriculture and she has a daughter who woks in the pig trade.

Elba has worked in agriculture for the past 10 years, specifically growing corn, beans, and coffee, all of which she learned from her mother, who worked in agriculture her whole life. She travels by foot and walks 30 minutes to work. 

She also has a mill in her home to help make some extra money and cover the needs of her family.

Elba needs the loan to buy cattle and fertilizer. She dreams of having a small cattle breeding business and to produce dairy to sell in her community.

María, 60 years old, studied until second grade because the situation of her parents would not allow her, them being poor. She got married and with her life partner she had three children. Unfortunately, their marriage didn't work and she had to commit alone in bringing up their children.

Following her husband's abandonment, María was struggling to support her children. It was then that she decided to open a store which has served her greatly because she has done well and has allowed her to generate income to be able to succeed and meet her needs.

María is requesting this loan to buy a heifer and feed it to later sell it at a good price and earn profits. She dreams of stocking her store to have more customers looking for her products and thus improve her financial income.

Petronila is a single mother, providing for five children. She has several business activities, mainly raising and selling cattle and pigs. She also butchers these kinds of animals. She launched her business ten years ago with her own money, she works from seven in the morning until five in the evening.

To improve her business she is asking for help with a loan, which she will use to buy cattle and pigs. She will raise them, fatten them and then sell them at a wholesale discount. She hopes to recoup the investment in a short time to quickly pay back the loan.

Her dream is to have a business that is well-known in the area, and offer her customers a better future.

Khouloud is a 31-year-old make up artist from Chouf, Lebanon. She is married and living with her husband and two children who both attend school.

Since she was a teenager, Khouloud enjoyed creating new looks using make up on her family and friends. In 2011, she decided to turn her hobby into a business by opening a small beauty salon inside her house. She provides her clients with all types of beauty related services such as hairdressing, make up, manicures and pedicures.

Khouloud's clients see her as a very hard working and professional woman. She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy a new set of equipment for hair dressing and make up.

The loan will allow Khouloud to work in better conditions by replacing her old equipment with a more efficient ones.

Her husband works as a security officer and earns a limited income. Therefore, Khouloud's business allows the family to increase the household's income

38-year old Angela is hardworking, dedicated to her family, and a dreamer. Ever since she was a small child, her greatest wish was to be a small businesswoman. With a lot of effort and discipline she has achieved her goal.

Today Angela runs a food cart. She starts work at 7 am and finishes at 8 pm daily. She sells all kinds of fried food, pastries, and drinks. Her hope is for her business to become known throughout the district as one of the best places to eat.

In order to succeed in this goal, Angela is now seeking a loan to buy ingredients and expand the range of food she offers so she can meet current demands. She hopes to improve her financial situation and her family's standard of living.

Being the only vendor of products for the home is a great advantage for moving her business forward, and it is a platform for Eloina to prosper and be motivated to triumph in her business venture and in the difficult market.

Her principal difficulty is the lack of capital to buy merchandise, and for this reason she wants to apply for a loan to buy products for the home, such as plates and cooking utensils, among other items, and in this way motivate the use of these products among her acquaintances and people of the neighborhood.

Her principal dream is to have a stable business and a commercial location, to improve sales, and to have this business give her economic stability and sufficient [income] to cover the needs of her family.

Lina is 35 years old and has two children. She lives in the municipality of Medellin. Since she was a little girl, she always hoped to have her own business and a family to provide for, and now she has both. She operates a general store, which she has been doing for three years. 

Lina works a lot in her store, not only to give to her family a good quality of life, but because she loves what she does and wants to see her store as a successful and recognized one. She wants to improve her sales and to increase the profits. Lina requested a loan, which she will use to buy some showcases and general stock items. 

Lina wants the best for her children and hopes to pay for a good education for all of them; she also would like to improve her house.

Alejandra is a 23 year old woman. She is single, without children, and her business is selling second hand clothing. She is happy, joyful and hard working. She works in the "Max Paredes" zone, characterized for grouping the largest manufacturing producers and commerce in all areas. With a cold a dry climate with a maximum temperature of 12 degrees Centigrades. Alejandra is dark complected, of short stature and wears thick lens glasses. Her native tongue is Aymara which she speaks at home with her family and she also speaks Spanish as general knowledge and at work. She lives with her parets who also work. They live in a rented room, built out of brick with corrugated metal roofing and wood floors. They have running water, electricity and sewage. Her business is selling women's second hand clothing, she buys cloths wholesale to sort and choose women's clothing. She then sells them and displays them on mannequins and hangers in her outdoor sales stand. "I starte the business with my sister, until I had enough capital to become independent..." she states. Her business is successful because she cleans and displays the clothing in an attractive manner. Th advantage of her business is that she sells her clothing by gender, the disadvantage is the lack of merchandise during the Christmas season. Her ream is to develop her business until it becomes more stable. She wants to buy furniture and mannequins for her business. This is the first loan with the institution in one year of activity. This is why Alejandra is asking for a loan to buy furniture and mannequins to sell clothes second hand.

Amal, a 35-year-old, Lebanese woman, started her clothes-selling business in Beirut back in 2010 in order to help her husband cover the children's school tuition fees. Her husband owns a shop that sells all types of curtains and her three children all go to school.

In her home-based shop, Amal sells clothes for women and children. She also sells perfume and accessories. This variety of products allows her to attract women and children in a very strategic location in Beirut.

Amal needs a loan to be able to meet the demands of her clients. She is asking for an LBP 2,571,003 (Lebanese pounds) loan for the first time, from Kiva partner, Ibdaa Microfinance SAL. She will be using the loan to buy new clothes and accessories her clients are asking for.

Amal is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her sales and income from her business. With this improved income, she will be supporting her husband in providing their three children with good living conditions.

Reyna is an enterprising woman who at 53 years of age has not stopped working hard every day. She has a store with new and used clothing, shoes, accessories and perfume amongst other products. For thirty years she has been a woman fighting to get her son ahead who has problems with his health, which has not stopped her from having a normal life.

She has appealed to Kiva y MiCrédito, hoping to be awarded a loan which will allow her to buy new merchandise like new clothing, shoes, sandals and perfume amongst others in keeping with the demand from her clients for the festive season. In the future she wants to be able to improve the infrastructure of her shop as well as open another store in one of the markets in her city.

Dalal is a 46-year-old married mother of two. Seven years ago, she started managing her husband's grocery shop so that he can focus on his scraps business. They are working hard to cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Dalal is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new collection of items and offers for the upcoming Christmas season.

Dalal hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

Manal is a 39-year-old housewife. She is responsible for her kid`s education. To be able to do so, she had to find a source of ‎income in addition to her husband`s income. So Manal started her own business and opened a beauty salon in her home. After she succeeded in that business and had regular customers, she opened an independent beauty salon. ‎Now she is applying for a loan in order to buy a new hair dryer, new tools for nails and new makeup to increase her quality ‎of work and increase her income so she will be able to help her husband more and more.‎

Enadis is a very hardworking person who through her efforts has managed to get her four children ahead by offering them a good quality education. She is a single mother. She has been selling clothing and shoes for a long time, and with great effort has overcome many obstacles in her way.

Currently Enadis has very good orders from her customers, and since she has not got much capital she is seeking a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale in response to the large number of orders from her customers. 

She spends ten hours a day at her business. Her biggest dream is for her business to get ahead, and this way she will be able to offer her children a good quality of life and greater financial stability. She knows that hand in hand with Interactuar she will be able to accomplish this.

Marelys is 50 years old and lives in the municipality of Sincelejo. She has three daughters whom she loves more than life, and they also have been a big support for her; they were the ones who pushed her to start her own business 10 years ago. Now she sells clothes to provide for them and her whole family.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy clothes to sell in this end-of-the-year season. She’s aware that she has to take advantage of this season because the sales are really good. She hopes she can be more competitive in the market and can make her business last over time. She dreams of paying for the best education for her daughters.

Help Marelys with the loan she needs so she can succeed in everything she’s been working so hard for for many years.

Elizabeth is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Sahagun. She has two children, one son and one daughter, and they are the most important thing in her life. Some years ago she studied how to sew and after that she started her own business sewing clothes, something that has allowed her to provide for her children. Now she wants to take her business to the next level.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some fabric, paints and inputs for making clothes, so with this she can increase production. She expects that the investment she´s about to make will improve her sales, will help her to be more competitive and will make her business last a long time. She dreams about paying for the best education for her children.

Elizabeth dreams big, and you can help her to accomplish it all. Loan now!

Safaa is a 40-year-old married mother of three. In 2003 she decided to establish her own perfume sales business to support her husband, who's working abroad to provide his family with the necessities of life.

Safaa is a hard working businesswoman who is putting forth a great effort to develop her business through increasing its capital with diversified products that attract customers' attention and increase her sales.

Safaa is developing her business properly, but sometimes she needs external financial support to buy certain occasional items she is not ready for. That's why, and since the Holy Christmas season is soon, Safaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas gifts and newly released cosmetics.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business as much as she can in a well-managed way.

Josephine, who is in her early 60s, is a widow with two adult daughters. For ten years now, she has been selling cold drinks at wholesale prices. Josephine works from ten in the morning through four in the afternoon and is able to make a very good monthly profit. She successfully repaid a previous loan that she used to increase her stock of drinks. Josephine used the profit from her first loan to take care of her family, repay her loan, and cover household expenses.

Josephine is requesting a loan to buy and sell drinks at retail and wholesale prices. This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Josephine is part of a loan group called Tabata Shule, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loan. Josephine appreciates Kiva’s support for their group. In the future, she dreams of owning a poultry business.

Ingris is 30 years and lives in the municipality of Planeta Rica. She has 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls between 14 and 7 years of age. It has been a complete challenge to raise her children, but she loves being a mother and feels proud of them.

Last year she started her own business, selling clothes. Her mother was the one who taught everything about this business, and she’s really grateful with her.

She wants to improve her sales and increase her clients, so she wants to stock up. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some stock like jeans, blouses and t-shirts to increase her products to sell.

Ingris is a mother who wants to see her children become great people, and wants them to be good members of the community, that’s why she dreams with paying for the best education for them. Help her to accomplish that and more with just a loan.

Leidy is a 24 year old woman who is asking for a loan to buy a selection of men's and women's clothing. She wants to take advantage of the end of the year season which is very soon.

She is an independent young woman who decided to generate her own work opportunities by starting a business. Now she hopes to be successful. With her business, her life plan is to buy a house, go to school, and have a family. That is why with the loan for clothing inventory, she is seeking to generate more sales to be financially sound and give her dreams free rein.

Judith is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 28,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more groceries such as canned goods, spices and noodles.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Judith dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

Milagro is a 28-year-old untiring worker who tends a grocery store business. She works 15 hours a day, all with the dream of increasing her earnings to thus give her family, which consists of her partner with whom she lives in free union and their two daughters, ages 10 and 12, an excellent quality of life and to build a good future.

Her intention is to become the best storekeeper, one who stands out for her service to her customers and her good stock. She works day after day with this dream and hopes that her business continues being useful for the community.

Milagro is applying for a loan to stock her business with rice, sugar, raw cane sugar, coffee, bread, toilet paper, beans, lentils, oil, eggs, arepas [filled corn tortillas], pastas, chocolate (liquid for consumption), and potatoes, among other items.

Doris is from the city of Medellín. She has worked in commerce for 14 years. She is separated, and with the help of her mother she has paved the way, and now she is very well known in the sector where her business is located.

She sells beauty products by catalog and prepares food.

She is a very hard-working and striving person who wants to get ahead and have a life full of successes and triumphs.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a stock of supplies and basic materials for perfumery and for preparing fast food so that she can improve her income through this work and can continue expanding her business in the best manner.

Noris is a humble, hard-working resident of the municipality of Medellín. Her life is full of dreams, hopes, and the best wishes for her family.

She is the mother of three children for whom she always had the courage and responsibility for making their lives the best.

Now she earns a living making and selling food. She transports these foods in a food cart. She works eight hours a day in her business.

Among the principal difficulties that she must face in her work are the strong rains and the high costs of the primary ingredients.

She is applying for a loan to purchase an umbrella to protect herself from the elements.

Since 2010, Maria has found a formula for feeling useful and generating her own income. She achieved this thanks to selling products by catalog.

Maria is a responsible, hardworking and service-minded 29-year-old woman. She's proud of not needing to ask anyone for money because she supports herself.

She's seeking a loan to buy merchandise in bulk to increase her sales. This is an uncommon business in her neighborhood, so she spends six to eight hours a day on her work.

With your help, Maria will be able to increase her capital and have a better livelihood. Support her today!

Dubis is a hard-working, independent woman. She is a 31 year old mother of two children aged 6 and 9 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship with her partner. She is a patient, responsible, tolerant and careful person who works offering beauty services. Her business was born from economic necessity and she hopes to improve the living conditions of her family with it and pay for the education of her children.

She dreams of becoming an important businessperson, having the most popular business in her area, having employees and a large infrastructure. To enjoy her earnings buy a house, an automobile, crazy dreams that she wants to make reality. She knows that everything starts with imagining it and putting everything into achieving your objectives.

The client works mainly giving manicures and pedicures but she finds herself requesting a loan to expand the services of her business, buying fixed assets to offer hair cuts, styling and straightening, amongst others. She will buy hair washing equipment, chairs for hair-cutting and supplies like dye and treatments amongst others.

She hopes that with this investment she can get new clients and take advantage of the end of the year season.

Consuelo is the owner of a restaurant. She is 57 years old and lives with her husband and son. She has had her business since the end of 2013, and now she wants to request a loan to do remodeling in her kitchen to have more space to work. This loan will allow her to continue with her business selling food and keep herself in the market, because she is the one who generates most of the income of her household. Her dream is to be able to pay for her son's education and to buy her own house.

The young woman, whose face is blurred for being 25 years old and living in a high-risk area, has been selling secondhand clothing for 8 years. 

Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many clients. With the profits she obtains from her sales she manages to cover some of the household expenses. 

This young woman lives with her life partner and her son. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more wholesale clothing and be able to continue selling, therefore increasing her income.

Heinys is a 20-year-old woman who has a hair salon. She started her business with the hope of achieving financial liberty and independence. 

She is a modest woman who helps her mother with food expenses. She is paying for her beauty classes and wants to get ahead in life: to have a house and a car. She thinks that there is no better way of achieving her goal than through dedication to her own business. 

She is requesting a loan to renovate her store and buy chemicals for hair dying and straightening, which will improve her business' infrastructure and allow her to have more supplies to help her customers.

Huda is a 38-year-old married woman who opened, almost a year ago, a grocery shop to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and a woman who is prepared to accept sacrifices. She is trying hard to develop her business, and is succeeding.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise with new items and offers for the upcoming Christmas season in order to better serve her customers.

She hopes to keep on expanding her business in the future in order to increase her income and provide her family with decent living conditions.

Souraya, 50, is a Lebanese owner of a beauty salon, living in Beirut with her husband and 3 children. Her eldest son works and helps his parents with the house expenses while her youngest daughter is finishing her university studies and will graduate next year.

Souraya and her husband have been running the beauty salon together since 1980. Her husband is the hairdresser and she handles the make-up and the beauty services for women.

For the first time, Souraya is asking for a loan of 1,234,327 Lebanese pounds from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to upgrade some of her salon's equipment, which is expected to increase her revenue. She also needs to purchase some additional coloring shampoo and supplies before the Christmas season and end of year holidays.

Souraya and her husband have their loyal clients who appreciate their professionalism, and their business has been working well for several years which motivates them to keep working hard to expand it.

Shazia is the age of 40 and is living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son just set up a mobile shop nearby his home. He offers various types of mobile phones and accessories, and provides a recharge facility. He has attained a list of customers in only a few days. 

Nowadays, he is facing problems due to the lack of available funds. He wants to increase his inventory of mobile accessories, which are very famous and costly nowadays. He just started this business and does not have more cash on hand to purchase the desired inventory. This is the reason Shazia contacted Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and requested a loan for her son. 

With the help of the loan, he can easily purchase mobiles accessories and extra recharge from various networks. In this way, he can easily attract more customers and can generate more income to cherish his family. 

Shazia is very thankful to lenders who take an active part in loan-raising.

Salma is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her family. He has been operating this business for many years, using wooden planks and bamboos which have been depreciated from time to time.

Salma's husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboos. Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new smooth wooden boards and bamboos to continue his business. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

Ángel is 38 years old. She doesn't have a high level of education and she is in a relationship and has two children, one of whom is studying in high school and the other is in elementary school.
Ángel had worked in agriculture along with her siblings since she was a child, but then she got into a relationship and her partner supported her financially to launch a small food business which she has now had for ten years. This stall is located in the market of her town. 
She needs the money from this loan in order to pay an architect who is helping her expand her business. Her aim is to improve her business, since improving it will increase her income and enable her to pay for her children's education.

María is 31-years old. She went to school until ninth grade. She is married, and her husband works as a brick layer. They have one son, who has started school.

For the last year, María has had a store selling basic needs items. Through her business, she helps her husband financially. The store is located in her home, and nobody else is involved in the business. María starts work at six o'clock in the morning.

María needs the loan to purchase detergents and staple grains so she can expand her business. The loan will improve her sales because she will have more merchandise.

María hopes to have a larger store so that her customers can find all manner of products in one place.

Mary Ann is 26 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, beers, bath soap and shampoo.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
